It is believed that Hi-Fi audio quality and a carefree, wireless listening experience make up the perfect music indulgence. Yet for a very long time, technical limitations have inevitably caused sound quality to be sacrificed to some extent when going wireless. Well, that’s not the case anymore, you can now have both with AQUA+!
column7:
s=78cc3295c64e43017d9a518cf4cf34b0"" src=""""/>

Perfectly designed for you with nothing to sacrifice and more to expect! 

AQUA+ provides powerful audio quality while enabling you to be freed from a specific music playing device. What could be more exciting? The future of music is wireless and you can keep using your favorite headphone with AQUA+.

column2: >
column10:
s=aaae48eb959199eded335d3138282cb4"" src=""""/>

AQUA+ also performs the following functions with the volume control key:

column1: Bluetooth V4.2: CSR64215 supports aptX, aptX LL, AAC, and SBC audio codec.
SRC DSP: High quality Sample Rate Conversion (SRC) chipset to transmit the original high resolution signal to DAC.

DAC+AMP: Ultra Hi-Res DAC (32bit/384K) powered by Cirrus Logic, one of the best Hi-Fi audio solution providers in the world. Comes with lower power consumption, the highest audio processing power for your favorite headphone. (supports 300Ω)

column3:
>

While 24 bit audio is considered “high resolution”, AQUA+ takes a further step to bring Sample Conversion Rate to 32 bit depth. With less information loss during the process of conversion, the HiFi DAC are able to capture more accurate data and reproduce these values to play them back in the same order and at the same rate at which they were captured for you to accurately hear the complete recreation of the original sound source.
>
column6:
>

We’ve successfully completed the pilot run before mass production and also confirmed sample tests for our packaging.

column1: With product certification in process too, AQUA+ is well on schedule  to fulfil delivery to our InDemand backer orders in December 2017.

column2:
>

Established in 2013, NEXUM is a team from Taiwan that focuses on wireless audio technology and never ceases to impress music lovers with innovative audio products. As music listening has become an indispensable part that spices up our daily lives, NEXUM strives to bring high quality music at an affordable price and the best listening experience in every possible way.

","It is believed that Hi-Fi audio quality and a carefree, wireless listening experience make up the perfect music indulgence. Yet for a very long time, technical limitations have inevitably caused sound quality to be sacrificed to some extent when going wireless. Well, that’s not the case anymore, you can now have both with AQUA+!Perfectly designed for you with nothing to sacrifice and more to expect! AQUA+ provides powerful audio quality while enabling you to be freed from a specific music playing device. What could be more exciting? The future of music is wireless and you can keep using your favorite headphone with AQUA+.

column1: AQUA+ also performs the following functions with the volume control key:
Bluetooth V4.2: CSR64215 supports aptX, aptX LL, AAC, and SBC audio codec.
SRC DSP: High quality Sample Rate Conversion (SRC) chipset to transmit the original high resolution signal to DAC.

DAC+AMP: Ultra Hi-Res DAC (32bit/384K) powered by Cirrus Logic, one of the best Hi-Fi audio solution providers in the world. Comes with lower power consumption, the highest audio processing power for your favorite headphone. (supports 300Ω)

While 24 bit audio is considered “high resolution”, AQUA+ takes a further step to bring Sample Conversion Rate to 32 bit depth. With less information loss during the process of conversion, the HiFi DAC are able to capture more accurate data and reproduce these values to play them back in the same order and at the same rate at which they were captured for you to accurately hear the complete recreation of the original sound source.
We’ve successfully completed the pilot run before mass production and also confirmed sample tests for our packaging.
With product certification in process too, AQUA+ is well on schedule  to fulfil delivery to our InDemand backer orders in December 2017.

column4: >We've Got You Covered

column1: New to high performance audio? No worries! We've got something that'll tickle your fancy.

column4: >High Performance Portable Audio Player
>Desktop Audio with No Equal
>What is Vi DAC?

column1: Vi DAC is a high performance digital to analog converter, or DAC, that connects to your home stereo. Like its creators, it does things a little differently.
A DAC is a device that converts digital data into glorious, analog audio. Not all DAC's are created equal, and this one really has no equal. Completely crowd-designed by our
column2: target=""_new"">Geek Force, Vi DAC is also called Geek Soul.

column5: >No-Compromise Architecture That's Fully Balanced and Dual Mono

column2: >Vi DAC uses a fully balanced architecture throughout its entire circuit, which results in the best noise rejection possible, and is the most natural way to cancel distortion. In addition, it uses a dual mono design, implementing dual ESS Sabre DAC chips, a dual separated power supply and a dual analog output stage.

column6: Connector Exchange (CCX)

column2: >The Capacitor and Connector Exchange is a module that inserts into the back of Vi Tube DAC that allows you to swap out its output capacitors and connectors. Basically, it's tube rolling... except it's with caps and connectors instead of tubes. All you have to do is follow a simple procedure that we'll provide you with, and you can swap in your favorite output cap/connector combination anytime without affecting your warranty.

>We feel very strongly about CCX, and have decided to add it to every Vi Tube DAC. It increases our cost, but doesn't affect your price. No matter which configuration of Vi Tube DAC you've chosen, CCX will be included.

column1:
Future Upgradeable
With CCX, your Vi Tube DAC is completely upgradeable. If you don't want to commit to additional modules now, you can do it later. The only risk is that the price for each module will be higher later.

User Serviceable
CCX modules are easily swapped in and out. All you have to do is power down your Vi Tube DAC, remove four screws, pull out one module, insert another, replace the four screws, and power up.

column5: >Eight CCX Options

column1: Standard Single-ended Configuration—  This module comes standard with your Vi Tube DAC. It features Wima film capacitors and Switchcraft RCA connectors.

Standard Balanced Configuration—  This module includes everything in the standard module plus a pair of Swedish-made Lundahl balanced output pransformers and a pair of Neutrik XLR output connectors. Backers of the Vi Tube Balanced Out Upgrade perk will receive this module, in addition to the CCX #1 module, automatically.

Mundorf MCap Evo SilverGold.Oil Single-ended Configuration—  This module features a pair of Mundorf EVO - Silver / Gold + OilFilm Capacitors! Our listening tests reveal a very transparent sound. It's a very ""precise-sounding"" capacitor for the kind of audiophile that enjoys a more ""Spectral/Wilson"" experience.

Mundorf MCap Evo SilverGold.Oil Balanced Configuration—  This balanced module takes CCX #3, and adds a pair of Swedish-made Lundahl balanced output transformers and a pair of Neutrik XLR output connectors, bringing the noise floor even lower for a clearer image and more defined soundstage.
Jupiter VT Series Film Single-ended Configuration—  Jupiter VT caps are known to be very sweet in the middle, which produces a classically warm, tubey sound. Tube rollers will love this one.

Jupiter VT Series Film Balanced Configuration—  This module takes the Jupiter VT silky sound, and lowers the noise floor with a pair of Lundahl balanced output transformers and Neutrik XLR output connectors.

V-Cap TFTF + Cardas Single-ended Configuration—  This capacitor is known to be a magnifier of the strengths and weaknesses of the entire signal chain. According to Larry, this is the best overall capacitor for this system. You'll find that the soundstage will widen, heighten, and deepen, providing a much more intimate experience with your music. Next, we've added Cardas ""Thick"" female connectors made of brass and plated with rhodium and silver. Our experience is that this connector, in comparison to our standard Switchcraft connector, helps to provide a cleaner sound in the lower frequencies.

V-Cap TFTF + Cardas Balanced Configuration—  This model adds Lundahl balanced output transpormers to the CCX #7 module. It also employes Cardas Gold XLR connectors. We use these connectors in our flagship products: Da Vinci and Sire DAC's. We think they're the best XLR connectors on the market.

column5: >The World's Most Versatile DAC

column2: >Vi DAC's versatility is unmatched. It features five digital inputs: one USB, one TOSLINK, one AES/EBU, and two S/PDIF. It outputs your analog music in two different ways. First, it has two headphone outputs on the front panel. One 1/4"" single-ended output, and one four pin XLR balanced output. Second, it outputs at line level through one pair of RCA single ended outs and one pair of XLR balanced outs. If you choose Vi DAC Tube, you'll get another pair of single-ended RCA outputs through the tube buffer stage. Additionally, if you choose the balanced tube output option, you'll get another pair of balanced XLR outputs.

column5: >Advanced 64 Bit Volume Control

column2: >In the past, attempts to engineer digital volume attenuation has been panned by audiophiles due to its very obvious ""digital-ness."" Analog volume control has been preferred, though it also presents a problem because of the noise that it generates. We've taken a different approach to volume control with our advanced 64 bit attenuation circuit, which uses an ultra-high resolution, zero noise, bit perfect mechanism.

>In the case of computer-based playback via USB, Vi DAC's volume attenuation circuit replaces the computer's volume calculations with its own, ensuring that your music remains bit perfect all the way through the conversion process. This way, it ensures that no information is lost before Vi DAC gets the data.

column5: >Automatical Digital Volume Control Shut Off

column2: >If you want to use the analog volume control of your preamplifier,set Vi DAC's digital volume attenuation circuit to -0dB, which completely bypasses the digital volume control circuit.

column5: >Individual Channel Control

column2: >In order to keep the digital music bit perfect, we've designed Vi DAC so that once it's volume is set to -0db, you can control the individual channels' attenuation settings to adjust balance.

>Most DAC aficionados understand the importance of digital filters. One of the major functions of digital filters is to remove the digital artifacts that the digital-to-analog conversion process adds to the signal.

>Vi DAC features several user-selectable digital modes that go beyond digital filtration. These modes were developed specifically to Vi DAC (all of our products feature digital modes specific for their application even though they may share the same name product to product). These modes not only change digital filtration settings, but also the digital PLL windows of the internal DAC IC, the re-clock jitter removal circuit, along with other hardware installed into the DAC.
>Users get the benefit of continuous upgrades to their digital modes through firmware releases.

>TCM (Time Coherence Mode) uses LH Labs' minimum phase digital filter and time optimization algorithm, which removes all PRE-ring from the converted signal and realigns the impulse response. This presents the listener with a more well-defined and natural soundstage. In short, this mode is optimized for time domain response.

>FRM (Frequency Response Mode) uses a slow roll-off linear digital filter and frequency domain optimization algorithm to provide a smoother and clearer sound with even lower THD+N in the high frequencies. The IMD in the higher frequencies is lower because of frequency response and high frequency artifact optimization.
>FTM (Femto Time Mode) minimizes the bandwidth of the DAC IC's digital PLL, providing even better jitter performance and better sound quality. Available for ALL of our femto clock equipped DACs.

>SSM (Stable Streaming Mode) is designed to optimize Vi DAC for streaming music. This mode combats two most important issues of streaming your music: time-fluctuated high jitter music content, and compressed roll off of high frequency harmonics. With SSM, Vi DAC will restore your streaming music's timing using our patent-pending three layer buffer. Expect a richer sound in the mid and high band frequency range.

column5: >Choose Your Music Format

column2: >Vi DAC decodes PCM (the most common music format, the one used in your CD's and MP3's) with bit rates of 16, 24, and 32 bits, and sample rates of 44.1 kHz, 48 kHz, 88.2 kHz, 96 kHz, 176.4 kHz, 192 kHz, 352.8 kHz, 384 kHz. It also natively decodes DSD music files (a rapidly-growing digital download format that audiophiles tend to love), letting you choose between five different filter modes, with sample rates of 2.822 MHz, 3.072 MHz, 5.644 MHz, 6.144 MHz, 11.288 MHz, and 12.288 MHz.

column5: >Dual Femtosecond Clocks

column2: >When it comes to digital audio playback, timing is paramount. The more accurate the timing, the more true to the original recording the playback is. For the most accurate timing available, we turn to femto clocks.

>Femto clocks are so named because they are accurate to a femtosecond. That's one millionth of one billionth of a second! Clocks like these aren't typically found in audio devices. They're usually in missile guidance systems. If you can find a DAC with a femto clock in it, you're on the right track. But the application of the clock (in our case more than one) is super important. For example, if you choose a clock that's accurate to a femtosecond but the frequency at which is oscillates is not a whole number integer of the audio frequency you're decoding, you still end up with jitter, the sworn enemy of high-performance digital audio.

>Our ultra-low jitter femto clocks are customized for us by Crystek Crystals, and are accurate to 85 femtoseconds when properly warmed up. Each DAC that uses them requires two separate clocks. One clock oscillates at 90.3168 MHz for audio signals that are sampled at a rate that is an integer multiple of 44.1 kHz, and the other oscillates at 98.304 MHz for audio signals that are sampled at a rate that is an integer multiple of 48 kHz.

>Our proper implementation of dual femto clocks ensures that the lease amount of jitter is introduced into the digital audio signal prior to its conversion into analog. The highest degree of harmonic integrity is retained, making the converted analog signal true to its digital origen. This translates to deep, black background, which gives the listener a sense of space and imaging that is unmatched in any DAC at any price.

column5: >Non Parallel Walls

column2: >Vi DAC's chassis has been designed to dissipate vibrations within the chassis that could otherwise be converted into electrical noise. By making a design without parallel walls, standing waves don't build up in corners, making it much less likely that noise will get into the circuit. This innovative design, based on our Da Vinci DAC's original chassis specification also creates enough internal volume to accommodate larger components such as capacitors and tubes.

column5: >Descended from Da Vinci DAC
>Ultra-quiet Linear Power Supply

column2: >Vi DAC's linear power supply employs 26 high quality regulators, including 4 discrete shunt regulators, making it among the quietest linear power in the industry. In addition, the power circuit is completely isolated from the digital and analog circuits, preventing mechanical noise from the transformer from entering the signal path.

column5: >Proprietary Three Layer Elastic Buffer

column2: >To ensure computer speed fluctuations don't smear your music, we've developed a proprietary (and patent-pending) Three-Layer Buffer similar to the buffering technology many of today's high-speed computers employ. This is the first time such a design has been applied to audio.

column5: >Bipolar Instant Power Technology

column2: >To address the issue of energy during power hungry times, our output stage uses an extremely low output Z bi-polar power supply, which keeps at least twice the rated power in reserve just in case you want the cannons in Tchaikovsky's 1812 Overture to feel like they're taking aim right at you.

>Vi's DAC's design has always been to utilize ESS' Sabre 9018 DAC microchip for its digital to analog conversion. New for 2015, ESS has released the 9018AQ2M, which boasts even better harmonic distortion characteristics than its predecessor, as well as a lower noise floor and greater dynamic range. You have the option to utilize this new chip if you so choose.
>For more info on ESS' new SABRE9018AQ2M, please click here.

column5: >Optional Hybrid solid-state/tube output buffer

column2: >A DAC has two main parts. First, the digital stage, and then the analog stage. Vi DAC's digital stage utilizes an advanced, proprietary solid-state design first implemented in our Da Vinci DAC. In the digital stage, precision timing and decoding is the most challenging part. Without precision, details blur and smear. The analog stage is where the magic happens. Vi DAC's solid-state analog stage is both musical and controlled at the same time. We've also designed an optional tube output buffer for those afficionados that love the warm and liquid sound of tubes.

column5: >Put Analog Back Into Your Music

column2: >For so many of us, the drawback to listening to digital music is that is sounds too, well, digital. Vi DAC does a great job delivering both precision and warmth to your stereo, but if you really want to put analog back into your music, choosing the optional Tube output buffer is a must. It uses 6922/6DJ8 tubes to give you a very wide bandwidth, and a low noise floor. With its warm and charming characteristics, prepare to spend a lot more time listening to your music!

column5: >Vi DAC's Tube Buffer Nerdy Highlights

column1: • Ultra-wide bandwidth design (100k Hz in this stage)
• Ultra-low noise discrete shunt regulator for B+
• Dedicated heater transformer and B+ transformer (only seen in very exotic designs)
• Soft start power network to make your tubes last longer.
• RIFA Film capacitors for active bias circuit decoupling
• Nichicon high-end capacitors for critical tube power coupling
• RIFA FILM CAPS to remove the final minor trace of power noise in B+

column4: >Vi DAC vs. Geek Pulse

column1: Vi DAC is a continuation of the development of Geek Pulse, so it's natural to wonder what the difference is between the two.

Geek Pulse is a solid state DAC which has been optimized for desktop use. It has a directly accessible volume attenuation knob on its front panel, along with up to two headphone outputs. Because of space constraints, it has been built with a 12V DC power input, and can pair with our linear power supply, called Geek LPS.
Vi DAC is a versatile DAC that has been optimized for home stereo use
column2: it fits perfectly into your audio furniture. Designed for use with a remote control, it comes in either a solid state or a hybrid solid state/tube configuration. With its elegant non-parallel wall design and bigger footprint than Geek Pulse, it takes its juice directly from either 120V or 240V AC power.

column1: Technologically, Vi DAC is superior to Geek Pulse in the following ways, including others:

• Vi DAC uses a 15V bi-polar power supply in its DAC module, compared to Geek Pulse' 12V power. The benefit is more headroom and 10% to 15% more power on the balanced headphone output. Additionally, Vi DAC has a slightly better power supply rejection ratio in the negative leg of the power supply.
• Vi DAC features an optional tube buffer stage, making it the most versatile DAC on the market.

• Vi DAC Tube features TWO pairs of single-ended and balanced output from solid state and also another TWO pairs of single-ended and balanced output from 6922/6DJ8 tubes (with optional balanced out from tube circuit).

column4: >The Vi Audio System is Growing

column1: Having an amazing DAC is one thing, but our vision is much larger than just one component. What's next?
Phase II: Vi Power Amp is a high performance power amplifier that connects to your home stereo, surround sound system or speakers.

Vi Power Amp brings out the best in your speakers using our VSI Matching technology, which simply and efficiently matches its output to your speakers' unique impedance characteristics. With perfectly matching impedance, your system will have new life, providing a better three dimensional soundstage, deeper bass notes and audio clarity second to none.

Besides dramatically improving sound quality, Vi Power Amp doesn't have external heat sinks, it doesn't get hot to the touch (thanks to its Multi-zone Class A Amplification), it doesn't eat up electricity, and it's smooth, sleek, and attractive. Basically, we got rid of everything that will make your spouse say, ""Don't bring that thing into my house!""

column4: >Why Are We Doing This Campaign?
>About LH Labs

column1: LH Labs is an amalgamation of audio geeks and engineers who have partnered together with one sole purpose in mind: bringing the sound of high-end audio to the masses.

Based in Northern California, the epicenter of the high-end audio industry, LH Labs was founded on the principal that music lovers deserve something better than just the ""usual."" We've made it our mission to create the best products possible for both audiophiles and music enthusiasts.

We've earned all kinds of awards, including a CES Innovations Honoree Award, A Publisher's Choice Award from TONEAudio, a Greatest Bits Award from Audio Stream, a Writer's Choice Award from Positive Feedback Online, and a Blue Moon Award from sixmoons.com. We've been featured in Forbes Magazine, Entrepreneur Magazine, The Wall Street Journal, The Los Angeles Times, The Street, Stereophile Magazine, The Absolute Sound, The Business Journals, and The Daily Swarm, among many other publications.

>Frequently Asked Questions

column1:
What kind of display does Vi DAC have?
Vi DAC has a 16 character OLED display that gives the user information such as volume attenuation and digital input. It also lets you access a menu system to control all the other features of the DAC. The display can also be turned off using an Apple remote control.

Is the firmware updatable?
Yes. This is another improvement over Geek Pulse. Vi DAC's firmware can be updated using an SD card. No more Windows-only firmware updates!

Does Vi DAC have a standby mode?
Yes, it does. Placeing Vi DAC in standby mode will help you conserve energy while it's not in use, but it keeps power going to strategic circuits. For example, the femto clocks will be kept warm, even in standby mode.

","We've Got You Covered
New to high performance audio?  No worries!  We've got something that'll tickle your fancy.
Vi DAC is a high performance digital to analog converter, or DAC, that connects to your home stereo.  Like its creators, it does things a little differently.

A DAC is a device that converts digital data into glorious, analog audio.  Not all DAC's are created equal, and this one really has no equal.  Completely crowd-designed by our Geek Force, Vi DAC is also called Geek Soul.
No-Compromise Architecture That's Fully Balanced and Dual Mono

Vi DAC uses a fully balanced architecture throughout its entire circuit, which results in the best noise rejection possible, and is the most natural way to cancel distortion. In addition, it uses a dual mono design, implementing dual ESS Sabre DAC chips, a dual separated power supply and a dual analog output stage.

The Capacitor and Connector Exchange is a module that inserts into the back of Vi Tube DAC that allows you to swap out its output capacitors and connectors.  Basically, it's tube rolling... except it's with caps and connectors instead of tubes. All you have to do is follow a simple procedure that we'll provide you with, and you can swap in your favorite output cap/connector combination anytime without affecting your warranty.

We feel very strongly about CCX, and have decided to add it to every Vi Tube DAC.  It increases our cost, but doesn't affect your price. No matter which configuration of Vi Tube DAC you've chosen, CCX will be included.

Future UpgradeableWith CCX, your Vi Tube DAC is completely upgradeable.  If you don't want to commit to additional modules now, you can do it later.  The only risk is that the price for each module will be higher later.

User ServiceableCCX modules are easily swapped in and out.  All you have to do is power down your Vi Tube DAC, remove four screws, pull out one module, insert another, replace the four screws, and power up.
Standard Single-ended Configuration—  This module comes standard with your Vi Tube DAC. It features Wima film capacitors and Switchcraft RCA connectors.

Standard Balanced Configuration—  This module includes everything in the standard module plus a pair of Swedish-made Lundahl balanced output pransformers and a pair of Neutrik XLR output connectors. Backers of the Vi Tube Balanced Out Upgrade perk will receive this module, in addition to the CCX #1 module, automatically.

Mundorf MCap Evo SilverGold.Oil Single-ended Configuration—  This module features a pair of Mundorf EVO - Silver / Gold + OilFilm Capacitors!  Our listening tests reveal a very transparent sound. It's a very ""precise-sounding"" capacitor for the kind of audiophile that enjoys a more ""Spectral/Wilson"" experience.

Mundorf MCap Evo SilverGold.Oil Balanced Configuration—  This balanced module takes CCX #3, and adds a pair of Swedish-made Lundahl balanced output transformers and a pair of Neutrik XLR output connectors, bringing the noise floor even lower for a clearer image and more defined soundstage.
Jupiter VT Series Film Single-ended Configuration—  Jupiter VT caps are known to be very sweet in the middle, which produces a classically warm, tubey sound.  Tube rollers will love this one.

Jupiter VT Series Film Balanced Configuration—  This module takes the Jupiter VT silky sound, and lowers the noise floor with a pair of Lundahl balanced output transformers and Neutrik XLR output connectors.

V-Cap TFTF + Cardas Single-ended Configuration—  This capacitor is known to be a magnifier of the strengths and weaknesses of the entire signal chain.  According to Larry, this is the best overall capacitor for this system.  You'll find that the soundstage will widen, heighten, and deepen, providing a much more intimate experience with your music.  Next, we've added Cardas ""Thick"" female connectors made of brass and plated with rhodium and silver.  Our experience is that this connector, in comparison to our standard Switchcraft connector, helps to provide a cleaner sound in the lower frequencies.

V-Cap TFTF + Cardas Balanced Configuration—  This model adds Lundahl balanced output transpormers to the CCX #7 module.  It also employes Cardas Gold XLR connectors.  We use these connectors in our flagship products: Da Vinci and Sire DAC's.  We think they're the best XLR connectors on the market.

Vi DAC's versatility is unmatched.  It features five digital inputs: one USB, one TOSLINK, one AES/EBU, and two S/PDIF.  It outputs your analog music in two different ways.  First, it has two headphone outputs on the front panel.  One 1/4"" single-ended output, and one four pin XLR balanced output.  Second, it outputs at line level through one pair of RCA single ended outs and one pair of XLR balanced outs.  If you choose Vi DAC Tube, you'll get another pair of single-ended RCA outputs through the tube buffer stage. Additionally, if you choose the balanced tube output option, you'll get another pair of balanced XLR outputs.

In the past, attempts to engineer digital volume attenuation has been panned by audiophiles due to its very obvious ""digital-ness.""  Analog volume control has been preferred, though it also presents a problem because of the noise that it generates.  We've taken a different approach to volume control with our advanced 64 bit attenuation circuit, which uses an ultra-high resolution, zero noise, bit perfect mechanism.

In the case of computer-based playback via USB, Vi DAC's volume attenuation circuit replaces the computer's volume calculations with its own, ensuring that your music remains bit perfect all the way through the conversion process.  This way, it ensures that no information is lost before Vi DAC gets the data.
Automatical Digital Volume Control Shut Off
If you want to use the analog volume control of your preamplifier,set Vi DAC's digital volume attenuation circuit  to -0dB, which completely bypasses the digital volume control circuit.
In order to keep the digital music bit perfect, we've designed Vi DAC so that once it's volume is set to -0db, you can control the individual channels' attenuation settings to adjust balance.

Most DAC aficionados understand the importance of digital filters.  One of the major functions of digital filters is to remove the digital artifacts that the digital-to-analog conversion process adds to the signal.

Vi DAC features several user-selectable digital modes that go beyond digital filtration.  These modes were developed specifically to Vi DAC (all of our products feature digital modes specific for their application even though they may share the same name product to product).  These modes not only change digital filtration settings, but also the digital PLL windows of the internal DAC IC, the re-clock jitter removal circuit, along with other hardware installed into the DAC.
Users get the benefit of continuous upgrades to their digital modes through firmware releases.

TCM (Time Coherence Mode) uses LH Labs' minimum phase digital filter and time optimization algorithm, which removes all PRE-ring from the converted signal and realigns the impulse response. This presents the listener with a more well-defined and natural soundstage. In short, this mode is optimized for time domain response.

FRM (Frequency Response Mode) uses a slow roll-off linear digital filter and frequency domain optimization algorithm to provide a smoother and clearer sound with even lower THD+N in the high frequencies. The IMD in the higher frequencies is lower because of frequency response and high frequency artifact optimization.
FTM (Femto Time Mode) minimizes the bandwidth of the DAC IC's digital PLL, providing even better jitter performance and better sound quality. Available for ALL of our femto clock equipped DACs.

SSM  (Stable Streaming Mode) is designed to optimize Vi DAC for streaming music. This mode combats two most important issues of streaming your music: time-fluctuated high jitter music content, and compressed roll off of high frequency harmonics. With SSM, Vi DAC will restore your streaming music's timing using our patent-pending three layer buffer. Expect a richer sound in the mid and high band frequency range.

Vi DAC decodes PCM (the most common music format, the one used in your CD's and MP3's) with bit rates of 16, 24, and 32 bits, and sample rates of 44.1 kHz, 48 kHz, 88.2 kHz, 96 kHz, 176.4 kHz, 192 kHz, 352.8 kHz, 384 kHz. It also natively decodes DSD music files (a rapidly-growing digital download format that audiophiles tend to love), letting you choose between five different filter modes, with sample rates of 2.822 MHz, 3.072 MHz, 5.644 MHz, 6.144 MHz, 11.288 MHz, and 12.288 MHz.

When it comes to digital audio playback, timing is paramount.  The more accurate the timing, the more true to the original recording the playback is.  For the most accurate timing available, we turn to femto clocks.

Femto clocks are so named because they are accurate to a femtosecond.  That's one millionth of one billionth of a second!  Clocks like these aren't typically found in audio devices.  They're usually in missile guidance systems.  If you can find a DAC with a femto clock in it, you're on the right track.  But the application of the clock (in our case more than one) is super important.  For example, if you choose a clock that's accurate to a femtosecond but the frequency at which is oscillates is not a whole number integer of the audio frequency you're decoding, you still end up with jitter, the sworn enemy of high-performance digital audio.

Our ultra-low jitter femto clocks are customized for us by Crystek Crystals, and are accurate to 85 femtoseconds when properly warmed up.  Each DAC that uses them requires two separate clocks.  One clock oscillates at 90.3168 MHz for audio signals that are sampled at a rate that is an integer multiple of 44.1 kHz, and the other oscillates at 98.304 MHz for audio signals that are sampled at a rate that is an integer multiple of 48 kHz.

Our proper implementation of dual femto clocks ensures that the lease amount of jitter is introduced into the digital audio signal prior to its conversion into analog.  The highest degree of harmonic integrity is retained, making the converted analog signal true to its digital origen. This translates to deep, black background, which gives the listener a sense of space and imaging that is unmatched in any DAC at any price.

Vi DAC's chassis has been designed to dissipate vibrations within the chassis that could otherwise be converted into electrical noise. By making a design without parallel walls, standing waves don't build up in corners, making it much less likely that noise will get into the circuit. This innovative design, based on our Da Vinci DAC's original chassis specification also creates enough internal volume to accommodate larger components such as capacitors and tubes.

Vi DAC's linear power supply employs 26 high quality regulators, including 4 discrete shunt regulators, making it among the quietest linear power in the industry.  In addition, the power circuit is completely isolated from the digital and analog circuits, preventing mechanical noise from the transformer from entering the signal path.

To ensure computer speed fluctuations don't smear your music, we've developed a proprietary (and patent-pending) Three-Layer Buffer similar to the buffering technology many of today's high-speed computers employ. This is the first time such a design has been applied to audio.

To address the issue of energy during power hungry times, our output stage uses an extremely low output Z bi-polar power supply, which keeps at least twice the rated power in reserve just in case you want the cannons in Tchaikovsky's 1812 Overture to feel like they're taking aim right at you.

Vi's DAC's design has always been to utilize ESS' Sabre 9018 DAC microchip for its digital to analog conversion.  New for 2015, ESS has released the 9018AQ2M, which boasts even better harmonic distortion characteristics than its predecessor, as well as a lower noise floor and greater dynamic range.  You have the option to utilize this new chip if you so choose.
For more info on ESS' new SABRE9018AQ2M, please click here.

A DAC has two main parts.  First, the digital stage, and then the analog stage.  Vi DAC's digital stage utilizes an advanced, proprietary solid-state design first implemented in our Da Vinci DAC.  In the digital stage, precision timing and decoding is the most challenging part. Without precision, details blur and smear.  The analog stage is where the magic happens. Vi DAC's solid-state analog stage is both musical and controlled at the same time.  We've also designed an optional tube output buffer for those afficionados that love the warm and liquid sound of tubes.
Put Analog Back Into Your Music

For so many of us, the drawback to listening to digital music is that is sounds too, well, digital. Vi DAC does a great job delivering both precision and warmth to your stereo, but if you really want to put analog back into your music, choosing the optional Tube output buffer is a must. It uses 6922/6DJ8 tubes to give you a very wide bandwidth, and a low noise floor. With its warm and charming characteristics, prepare to spend a lot more time listening to your music!

Active Biased Parafeed Single-ended (ABPS) Tube Buffer
Ultra-wide bandwidth design (100k Hz in this stage)
Bessel Analog Filter before tube grid
Ultra-low noise discrete shunt regulator for B+
Dedicated heater transformer and B+ transformer (only seen in very exotic designs)
Soft start power network to make your tubes last longer.
RIFA Film capacitors for active bias circuit decoupling
Nichicon high-end capacitors for critical tube power coupling
RIFA FILM CAPS to remove the final minor trace of power noise in B+

Whooshi is a Hi-Fi amplifier that changes your existing headphones from wired to Bluetooth and allows wireless transmission of high-quality audio from any smartphone, tablet or laptop. And there’s more. The music player App for iOS and Android tailors the sound to your ears so you can hear your music the way it's meant to be heard.

Whooshi has been engaged in audio technology development since 2016. The company’s mission is to adapt sound to each person’s individual hearing level. At the same time, Whooshi understands that the future belongs to wireless sound-transmission technologies, so the company’s first product combines personalized sound with a wireless amplifier.

The best engineers at Infomir, the manufacturer of MAG set-top boxes for IPTV/OTT, are responsible for the technical side of this product. Thanks to the team’s combined experience in hardware product development, Informir’s excellent R&
column2: D laboratory, an established network of suppliers and partners, and dedicated customer support staff, many of the company’s products enjoy worldwide popularity.

column1: In addition to its engineering staff, Whooshi collaborates with other experts who work professionally with all aspects of sound, including sound producers, sound designers and musicians. Our team of sound specialists also includes an audiologist and a psychoacoustics expert.

Whooshi has been engaged in audio technology development since 2016. The company’s mission is to adapt sound to each person’s individual hearing level. At the same time, Whooshi understands that the future belongs to wireless sound-transmission technologies, so the company’s first product combines personalized sound with a wireless amplifier.

The best engineers at Infomir, the manufacturer of MAG set-top boxes for IPTV/OTT, are responsible for the technical side of this product. Thanks to the team’s combined experience in hardware product development, Informir’s excellent R&D laboratory, an established network of suppliers and partners, and dedicated customer support staff, many of the company’s products enjoy worldwide popularity.

In addition to its engineering staff, Whooshi collaborates with other experts who work professionally with all aspects of sound, including sound producers, sound designers and musicians. Our team of sound specialists also includes an audiologist and a psychoacoustics expert.",26.0,4,"1 Campaign

Vokyl is a gaming audio brand passionate about high quality sound. We’ve seen up close the attention to detail audio engineers put into titles, and we are bringing the same dedication to our first headset, Erupt. With Erupt, Vokyl delivers a ready-to-play analog solution for immersive experiences, competitive gaming, and clear chat. No LEDs. No digital frills. Only the accurate, crystal clear sound that for years has been missing from mainstream gaming audio products.

We believe gamers should be able to use their console and PC features to the fullest without compromising their preferences or making hardware modifications. By making Erupt analog we put you, the listener, in control of your sound.

Vokyl focuses on quality above all else. Designed, machined, and assembled in St. Louis, Missouri, Erupt, with its CNC-milled aluminum chassis, is the new gold standard in build quality and dependability.

The user experience should be as simple and straightforward as possible, providing the best clarity and sound with minimal interference. By not altering the signal with DSPs or active circuity, Erupt preserves the gameplay sound the title’s engineers carefully designed. If desired, a 3D software option of your choosing can be added, but we wanted to keep that choice for you, the listener.

Before we decided to build Erupt, we spent years using every solution on the market: high-end headsets with 3rd-party peripheral boom or desktop USB mics, wireless headsets, and lackluster all-in-one solutions. Not a single one gave us the audio experience we wanted, so we set out to build one that did.  Erupt, a simple, one wire solution. No dongles or add-ons. No batteries to charge.

We designed Erupt for marathon raid and grinding sessions where comfort is essential. The two key elements of a comfortable headset are where it touches your skull: the earpads and headband. Our super soft suspension headband fits your head automatically. The slim profile means no unnecessary bulk or weight.

Erupt’s earpads have been ergonomically designed for both optimal comfort and sound quality. Each pad option has been optimized for acoustic airflow. The vented option delivers a linear, quick, and wide soundstage. The solid option delivers a more isolated, dynamic experience. The listener can adjust the earpad to match the specific subjective preference and environment.
Most current headset manufacturers are all using the same, inexpensive driver style: 40mm neodymium. This ubiquitous driver is as common as it is mediocre.
We wanted something different. Our team decided to start from scratch, designing a driver from the ground up using aluminum magnesium, a well-kept secret from the high-end audio world.

Vokyl carefully designed our proprietary Al-Mg driver for optimal dynamic driver performance. We utilized a thick rubber surround to isolate the membrane, creating a sonic surface that vibrates singularly on its own, without influence from surrounding components. Finding the proper stiffness for the surround to match with the Al-Mg material brought about optimal resonance for a natural, punchy, and engaging tone.

To round out the driver, we used heavy (relative to drivers) and powerful N50 neodymium magnets stacked on each other to provide sound with weight, substance, and texture that will leave you listening just for the fun of it.
Vokyl chose the larger, 50mm size for the perfect balance between a large encompassing sound and low distortion. This optimal surface size decreases standing waves which can disrupt your experience.
Airflow is optimized with a multi-pore system that lets air uniformly enter and exit the driver chamber, allowing us to dampen the headphone to a specific, desired tuning.

The drivers themselves are protected and secured by lightweight aluminum cups machined here in our shop in St. Louis, Missouri. The drivers are placed in an angular housing for a natural sound experience and a massive soundstage.

By using stiff aluminum housing with a specific damping scheme for our semi-open design, we have created the Erupt to have the utmost in dynamic range, smoothness, and spatial clarity. We also chose an acoustic fabric to provide just the right amount of internal damping and airflow, with our airflow system designed to get the most from our proprietary Al-Mg drivers. 
Erupt truly brings the most out of movies, music, and gaming.

While Erupt’s drivers make it a great choice for games, music, and movies, the mic setup is just as unique. This boom mic is fully detachable, mutable, and houses two separate microphones that the user can toggle on the fly.
The unidirectional, noise-cancelling mic is great for louder, chaotic environments. The omnidirectional mic is perfect for quieter spaces and the best choice for studio quality chat.

While we’ve all worked in the audio industry for the better part of a decade, Erupt’s journey began in 2016 after one of us bought a headset for our Playstation, and another, and then another, until we realized that there was literally nothing out there that had truly hi-fi grade sound, a mic, and great design.

We’ve come a long way since firing shots at each other in Battlefield 4 to where we are today, building the Erupt. We’ve spent many long days and nights refining every aspect of the headset, from the industrial design to the fitment to the sound quality, all down to the smallest detail. We believe Erupt will profoundly change your gaming experience. That’s why we built it.

Our founders have been working together for years to bring audio hardware to market, landing in publications like GQ, CNET, and Design Milk. We see the Erupt as our next chapter and invite you to join us on this adventure.

We’ve completed all the designing, prototyping, 3D printing, machining, testing, listening, and gaming we need to. This headset is ready to be made. Your funds will be used exclusively on only what’s needed to get Erupt out the door and on to your head.
Here's where your funding will be going...

We need to purchase tooling for the headband attachment, driver housing, and earpad clip. We are currently using 3D prints in place of these parts. The prints have been helpful and necessary for prototyping and testing purposes. However, they aren’t a scalable solution. Your backing will provide us with the funds to cover the tooling and mold costs of these parts. While a one-time cost, tooling is the most expensive part of our production equation and where we need your help the most.

The good news? Our custom drivers are rockin’ and ready to go. The bad news? We don’t have the funds to build enough of them. With your backing, we will be able to have our proprietary Al-Mg drivers produced at scale.

As good of machinists as we are, the Vokyl team can’t mill headphone cups and yokes out of thin air. We need to order aluminum stock, which is most economically done in bulk. Your support will help us get the best price possible and ensure these headsets are built and delivered at a brisk pace.

Fortunately, we have a background in manufacturing and a shop full of machines to produce all the aluminum components. We have existing relationships with suppliers that have produced our initial sample order of pads, headbands, and halos. We are working with a driver manufacturer experienced and well-known in the high-end audio community, as we all an industry respected microphone manufacturer to round out the audio components of the headset.

We've included a section in our funding tiers where you can become part of the Vokyl team with any size donation, but you don't have to stop your support there! We've included links where you can share this campaign all over the internet and social media. Join the squad by buying a headset, providing some funding, or sharing our campaign page with some kind words!
Let us know if you have any questions about the indiegogo share tools!
Is the Vokyl Erupt designed for the Switch, Xbox One, PS4, or mobile?
Yes! The switch uses a completely analog signal, so you can use it for any one of these things. We will say that you will need an adapter if your phone does not have a headphone jack :(
No! We designed the Erupt to be your new audio secret weapon, your Jose Oquendo. It will give you a fantastic headphone experience whether you use it for gaming, movies, or music.

You probably see our headset and are thinking “Wow the Vokyl guys are a bunch of surround sound haters”. We don’t hate surround sound. We love surround sound. We think that surround sound is awesome. We just think that it's best delivery method for headphones is software, not hardware. Engineers put a lot of work into in-game sound design and there's some great free surround software out there, so we encourage you to use those options with your Erupt headset.
What if I have a studio/desktop mic?
Great! Desktop mics are top quality gear. Simply detach your boom mic from the Erupt headset and you’re good to go! You’ll use the Erupt as a pair of headphones and your mic as you always have.
What if I have a headphone amp and/or DAC?

Ooh you know what you’re doing. This is probably the best way to use the Erupt. For headphone use, you’ll use the Erupt via whatever output your amp has. For headset use, you’ll need a splitter to utilize your amp/sound card’s mic input.
I wear glasses, will this headset crush my temples?
While no one on the Vokyl team is a nerd with corrective eyewear, we have heard from several nerds that these are some of the most comfortable headphones they’ve worn with their glasses.

Take a deep breath, it’s going to be okay. All of our assembly, testing, designing, engineering, machining, and laundry is done at our St. Louis facility. So, while we don’t have a set in stone return policy up and running just yet, shoot us an email and odds are we’ll just take it back in the nest and make it good as new.

Modal Electronics are proud to announce the latest in its line of innovative Machines For Musicians - the Modal Electronics SKULPTsynthesiser.
column2:
>

 

Packing a huge range of synthesis power in a highly portable package, Modal SKULPT is ready to help you take your creativity to the next level wherever and whenever you want.

wmode=transparent"" width=""612"">

 

An overview of its features shows SKULPT pushes the bar up in portable electronic musical instruments:

column1: • 8 oscillators per voice with 2 selectable morphable waveforms
• Mixer stage for osc levels along with FM, PWM, tuning and Ring Modulation options
• Multi option Unison / spread to detune the 32 oscillators for a huge sound
• 8 slot modulation matrix with 8 sources and 37 destinations
• 3 x envelope generators for Filter, Amplitude and Modulation
• 2 x audio rate LFOs, one global and one polyphonic
• Realtime sequencer that will record up to 128 notes and up to 4 parameters
• Fully featured arpeggiator with division, direction, octave, swing and sustain controls
• Resonant filter that can be morphed from low pass, through band pass, to high pass
• Delay and distortion (waveshaping overdrive, not bitcrushing) effects
• Optional MIDI clock sync for LFOs and Delay
• MIDI DIN In and Out – Analogue clock sync In and Out connections
• Class compliant MIDI provided over USB connection to host computer or tablet
• Powered by USB or 6 x AA batteries
• Optional software editor available for macOS, Windows, iOS and Android
• Includes protective lid, which fits underneath to provide a raised working surface if desired
• Available in either white or black finish

Software Editor MODALapp

Modal SKULPT synthesiser also has an optional free standalone software editor available for macOS, Windows, iOS and Android.

The software editor provides a visual overview of the SKULPT and also provides patch management, a MIDI keyboard and easy integration with the Modal CRAFT range. Simply connect SKULPT to any device running one of the supported operating systems with a Micro USB cable and you are good to go...

The software editor is completely optional and not required to use any of SKULPT synthesiser's sound engine.

 

 

Whats in the box?
Runs on USB or battery power (requires 6 x AA batteries, not included in the box)

column2: >

column1: Modal took one of the pre-production SKULPT synthesisers to Sonic Towers for Nick Batt of Sonic State to have a good poke at the SKULPT’s features and sounds

Rewards / Perks

As well as Modal Electronics SKULPT synthesiser we are offering a few extra perks including  the CRAFTrhythm drum sampler:

 

Modal Electronics CRAFTrhythm

Uniquely for our SKULPT Indiegogo InDemand programme, some of our perks give you the chance to snag a Modal Electronics CRAFTrhythm Drum Sampler - here's some more details about our CRAFTrhythm.

The Modal CRAFTrhythm is an 8 track drum sampler kit with a 16 step sequencer which can be assembled (without need to solder) in less than 10 minutes. The CRAFTrhythm can store up to 64 16bit mono samples with a sample rate of 44.1kHz and using the CRAFTapp users can upload their own sounds. Each track features a mixer, sample select, a tune control with 3 pitch modes, low pass resonant filter and 3 envelopes for amplitude, filter and pitch. 16 preset patterns can be stored on CRAFTrhythm with up to 16 part pattern chaining along with 8 kits that recalls track parameters.

Why Indiegogo?

Modal has over the past four years sold its products through a number of dealers around the World and we do not see this changing. 

However, Modal is always looking for new ways to help customers get access to our products and like many other established companies, Modal sees Indiegogo InDemand as a new, fresh and innovative way of reaching people the World over. 

 

 

Product Development Background

column1:
Timeline

You can find our current project timeline estimate below. Of course this maybe subject to change, especially due to the long lead times on some electronics components at the moment. However, we believe this is a generous estimate and we hope to be able to deliver before the date below.
• Ship Modal SKULPT synthesisers to Kickstarter backers
• Ship Modal SKULPT synthesisers to Indiegogo InDemand backers
We are a team of developers, designers and musicians who design and manufacture electronic musical instruments, based in Bristol, UK.
column2: >
column3:
>Modal 002R, 002, 008 and 001

 

Established in 2013, we have previously released a range of highly regarded instruments such as Modal 002 - the fully-multitimbral 12 voice digital/analogue hybrids synthesiser, Modal 008 - the 8 voice analogue powerhouse synthesiser and the Modal CRAFT range - synthesiser and drum sampler kits that broke new ground in price vs performance.
column4: >
column5:
>Modal CRAFTsynth and CRAFTapp

 

We make 'Machines for Musicians'

www.modalelectronics.com

 

 

Partners
column6:
>

 Almond Design Studio

""It is the purpose of design to give character and identity to what is otherwise an inanimate object. It is to allow a product to explain itself to the user
column7:
to generate a joy in its use and impart pleasure in its ownership.""

Trained in Product Design at the Royal College of Art, London, John Almond's award winning practice has been a forerunner in the use of computer aided design techniques since their inception. His work is now predominently in the area of high technology products, and has worked for clients that include Virgin, Sharp, Citizen, Hitachi, Mitsubishi, Atomos, Pace and IBM. He worked with Nokia in Finland for 6 years on their corporate design programs, and has been a regular visiting lecturer on MA Product Design courses both at the Royal College of Art and at Manchester Metropolitan University.

www.almond.uk.com

 

 

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ):

 

Why is Modal using Indiegogo InDemand?

Modal has over the past four years sold it's products through a number of dealers around the World and we do not see this changing. 

However, Modal is always looking for new ways to help customers get access to our products and like many other established companies, Modal sees new channels such as Indiegogo and Kickstarter as new, fresh and innovative ways of reaching people the World over – often in countries where it’s traditionally been hard or impossible to buy Modal products.

Following our incredibly successful Kickstarter campaign, we’ve received so many requests to purchase SKULPT from people who missed out on the original Kickstarter campaign – and so we’ve launched this Indiegogo InDemand campaign to help people pre-order from production, after the Kickstarter units are delivered.

 

 

Why are SKULPT perks different prices for different countries? Why are some perks cheaper?

Modal Electronics Ltd is a European VAT registered company. Therefore, by law, we are required to sell and advertise our products including European VAT for residents of those countries within the European Union. We have created separate perk levels for those not within the EU that do not have VAT included but please be aware you may be charged taxes upon importation by your local / national authorities. This is beyond the control of Modal Electronics Limited.

 

 

Why does the perk I want not ship to the country I live in?

If you are outside the specified countries for a specific perk you would like to purchase please let us know and we will add your country to the list.

 

 

What’s in the box?

1 x Modal Electronics SKULPT synthesiser 
1 x Modal Electronics SKULPT lid / cover 
1 x Micro USB cable

 

 

What interfaces does SKULPT have?

- Stereo audio out 3.5mm jack 
- Dedicated headphones 3.5mm jack 
- USB Micro for Class Compliant MIDI and power 
- MIDI 5-pin DIN In and Out 
- Analogue clock sync In and Out 3.5mm jacks

 

 

What kind of USB connector does SKULPT use?

SKULPT uses a USB Micro connector for Class Compliant MIDI and power

 

 

Does SKULPT have a built in speaker?

No.

There are two audio out ports on SKULPT: 
- Stereo audio out 3.5mm jack 
- Dedicated headphones 3.5mm jack

 

 

What software / hardware do I need to use SKULPT?

SKULPT is a standalone hardware instrument that only requires headphones or line-out to speakers to be used. 

SKULPT also has an optional free software editor - that runs on macOS, Windows, iOS and Android - that provides you with larger format visual editing, if desired.

SKULPT is also MIDI compatible and can be connected to external MIDI hardware / software via MIDI-DIN ports or USB (as a Class Compliant USB MIDI device), allowing it to be controlled by the majority of MIDI keyboards, controllers, and DAWs. 

SKULPT also has analogue clock sync ports for syncing with certain other devices and modular synth systems.

 

 

What features does the MODALapp provide? Do I need to use the app to use SKULPT?

MODALapp is an optional free software editor for SKULPT that runs on macOS, Windows, iOS and Android.

It includes the following features: 
- Full editor with visual representation of all controls including sequencer and animator 
- Visual representation of the Mod Slots modulation matrix 
- Librarian functionality for patches and sequences 
- Additional utility settings such as MIDI filtering and MIDI routing

The software editor is completely optional and not required to use any of SKULPT synthesiser's sound engine.

 

 

Can I connect multiple SKULPT’s to the same computer?

Yes. 

In this situation each SKULPT will appear as a separate USB-MIDI device, and if using MODALapp each SKULPT will be accessible via it's own tab on the UI.

 

 

Is SKULPT polyphonic, paraphonic or monophonic?

SKULPT is polyphonic - it has four voices of true polyphony.

Each voice is made up of eight oscillators, and using SKULPT's Voice Mode patch parameter this can be configured in three different ways: 
- poly: one note plays one voice 
- duo: one note plays a two voice stack 
- mono: one note plays a four voice stack

 

 

Does SKULPT have Frequency Modulation (FM) capabilities?

Yes - the SKULPT FM parameter sets wave 2 to modulate wave 1.

 

 

Does SKULPT support velocity, aftertouch or MPE?

The SKULPT touch keyboard does not provide key velocity or aftertouch, however Velocity and Aftertouch from MIDI-in are two of the eight modulation sources on SKULPT that can modulate 37 destinations through an 8 slot modulation matrix.

SKULPT does not currently support MPE (MIDI Polyphonic Expression), however it is under consideration for a future update as we have already implemented MPE into the Modal 002/001/002R.

 

 

Can I play more than one note simultaneously on the touch keyboard?

Yes.

The touch keyboard on SKULPT is fully multitouch and allows you to play all 4 voices of SKULPT simultaneously. If using SKULPT as a MIDI keyboard it is possible to transmit notes from all 16 keys at the same time.

 

 

Does SKULPT have MIDI thru?

Yes.

SKULPT is designed to live in a big MIDI setup, so it has a 'soft' MIDI Thru that can be enabled in software. There are two MIDI Thru options: 
1. DIN Thru: DIN-In ->
column11:
USB-Out

 

 

What standard does the SKULPT analogue clock sync In and Out use?

The SKULPT analogue clock sync in and out are configured to the KORG / Teenage Engineering specification.

 

 

What batteries does the SKULPT take and how long will the power it for?

If wanting to power SKULPT by batteries instead of USB, it will require 6 AA batteries (sold separately).

There are several variables that determine how longer the batteries will last for including the quality &
column12:
condition of battery cells used, environmental factors such as the ambient temperature (which seriously effects alkaline cells), how much the keyboard is used, whether MIDI and USB are being used, headphones vs. line out etc. But so far we are seeing at least 12 hours of play time in a nominal testing environment. We intend to conduct more extensive battery tests over the course of the campaign.

 

 

Are there any functionality differences between the white and black SKULPT's?

No - the finish colour is the only difference.

 

 

What is the manufacturer’s warranty on Modal SKULPT?

Modal offers a one year warranty against manufacturing defects on a return to service centre basis.

 

 

How long will it take for you to deliver my SKULPT?

We are estimating to ship all SKULPT's to backers by November 2018, shipping to Kickstarter backers first followed by Indiegogo InDemand backers.

 

 

Is SKULPT a kit synthesiser, like the Modal CRAFTsynth?

No. 

SKULPT is delivered as a fully working unit. Simply plug into a USB port on your computer or install AA batteries, plug in headphones or connect to your mixer or audio interface, and start making music straight away.

column1: Modal Electronics are proud to announce the latest in its line of innovative Machines For Musicians - the Modal Electronics SKULPTsynthesiser.  Packing a huge range of synthesis power in a highly portable package, Modal SKULPT is ready to help you take your creativity to the next level wherever and whenever you want.
Features An overview of its features shows SKULPT pushes the bar up in portable electronic musical instruments:
8 oscillators per voice with 2 selectable morphable waveforms
Mixer stage for osc levels along with FM, PWM, tuning and Ring Modulation options
Monophonic, Duophonic and Polyphonic modes available
Multi option Unison / spread to detune the 32 oscillators for a huge sound
8 slot modulation matrix with 8 sources and 37 destinations
3 x envelope generators for Filter, Amplitude and Modulation
2 x audio rate LFOs, one global and one polyphonic
Realtime sequencer that will record up to 128 notes and up to 4 parameters
Fully featured arpeggiator with division, direction, octave, swing and sustain controls
Resonant filter that can be morphed from low pass, through band pass, to high pass
Delay and distortion (waveshaping overdrive, not bitcrushing) effects
Optional MIDI clock sync for LFOs and Delay
MIDI DIN In and Out – Analogue clock sync In and Out connections
Class compliant MIDI provided over USB connection to host computer or tablet
Powered by USB or 6 x AA batteries
Optional software editor available for macOS, Windows, iOS and Android
Includes protective lid, which fits underneath to provide a raised working surface if desired
Available in either white or black finish
Software Editor MODALappModal SKULPT synthesiser also has an optional free standalone software editor available for macOS, Windows, iOS and Android.MODALapp

The software editor provides a visual overview of the SKULPT and also provides patch management, a MIDI keyboard and easy integration with the Modal CRAFT range. Simply connect SKULPT to any device running one of the supported operating systems with a Micro USB cable and you are good to go...The software editor is completely optional and not required to use any of SKULPT synthesiser's sound engine.  Whats in the box?
Runs on USB or battery power (requires 6 x AA batteries, not included in the box)
As Seen OnPublishers featuring Modal SKULPTsynthesiser
Modal took one of the pre-production SKULPT synthesisers to Sonic Towers for Nick Batt of Sonic State to have a good poke at the SKULPT’s features and sounds

Rewards / PerksAs well as Modal Electronics SKULPT synthesiser we are offering a few extra perks including  the CRAFTrhythm drum sampler: Modal Electronics CRAFTrhythmUniquely for our SKULPT Indiegogo InDemand programme, some of our perks give you the chance to snag a Modal Electronics CRAFTrhythm Drum Sampler - here's some more details about our CRAFTrhythm.

The Modal CRAFTrhythm is an 8 track drum sampler kit with a 16 step sequencer which can be assembled (without need to solder) in less than 10 minutes. The CRAFTrhythm can store up to 64 16bit mono samples with a sample rate of 44.1kHz and using the CRAFTapp users can upload their own sounds. Each track features a mixer, sample select, a tune control with 3 pitch modes, low pass resonant filter and 3 envelopes for amplitude, filter and pitch. 16 preset patterns can be stored on CRAFTrhythm with up to 16 part pattern chaining along with 8 kits that recalls track parameters.

Why Indiegogo?Modal has over the past four years sold its products through a number of dealers around the World and we do not see this changing. However, Modal is always looking for new ways to help customers get access to our products and like many other established companies, Modal sees Indiegogo InDemand as a new, fresh and innovative way of reaching people the World over.   Product Development Background
Design concept - Portable synth with 16 capacitive buttons for keyboard and step sequencer
Piano style capacitive touch keys - THE ONE!
April 2018 - Final 3D design renders and software editor ui design
First plastic prototype made using Stereolithography (SLA)

TimelineYou can find our current project timeline estimate below. Of course this maybe subject to change, especially due to the long lead times on some electronics components at the moment. However, we believe this is a generous estimate and we hope to be able to deliver before the date below.
Launch on Indiegogo InDemand for pre-orders
Submit MODALapp to platform app stores
Ship Modal SKULPT synthesisers to Kickstarter backers

column4: >""Everyone is still boogying after your presentation at Watermill"" -Robert Wilson

column1: The Craft:
• A Sound Shade is lightweight, well-balanced, and a pleasure to hold.
• The parasol is handmade of bamboo and paper, reinforced with our special coating that enhances sound quality and durability.
• A uniquely sculpted handle houses all of the electronics.
• The audio driver in the handle produces deep bass that you can feel as well as hear.
• The parasol canopy is available in a selection of colors and designs.
• The handle is CNC crafted in a selection of solid woods and flame-polished acrylic.
• Wireless audio streaming module supports Bluetooth 4.0, high-quality codecs, onboard DSP for equalization, and future firmware enhancements.
• 8 AAA batteries fit neatly inside the handle, providing many hours of playtime.
• Agile power conditioning, so rechargeable NiMH cells or common alkaline batteries can be used.
• The handle design allows quick battery replacement, for continuous play.
• Standard 1/8"" stereo mini jack allows direct connection to external wired audio playback sources.
• Output jack allows connection to a second parasol for automatic stereo pairing.
• A single, simple control for volume and power on/off.
• A mobile app (in development) will provide creative control of sound effects and music in response to gestural movement of the parasol.
Simply put, we wouldn't be making these if they didn't sound so good.

We've been working hard on this design for over a year already. Our patent-pending technology has fundamentally better transient response, phase coherence and bass extension than normal surface exciters.

Specifically, the vertical dipole configuration provides astonishingly full sound under the parasol, without dominating the acoustic space of other people. The bamboo truss and our specially coated paper creates a serendipitous concentric radiator. The vibrotactile handle lets you feel the music as well as hear it. We've evaluated dozens of transducers, amplifiers and materials and picked the very best.

We have a roadmap to refinement in future upgrades, but what we are producing today already sounds amazing. Experts in materials science, signal processing, plenacoustics and embedded systems are interested in helping us realize the potential they've witnessed.

Hi. We're two inventors, musicians and sound designers. We've spent 25 years creating, producing, engineering and building sound, sound systems and devices.

Three years ago, we discovered a new way to make high-end sound emanate from a variety of materials and objects, including watercolor paper and living plants.

We've built prototypes of various applications using our new technology for theater, gallery installations, consumer products, musicians, dancers and costume designers. All of these have been one-off projects.

The funding from this campaign will enable us to build our first stand alone product that we can share with everyone. It will also support our continuing R&
column2:
D into new applications of this sound technology.

How can you help? Buy a parasol and share it. The parasol isn't just a beautiful object. It's a full sensory experience. Hearing, holding and feeling the sound is unique and exhilarating. We've witnessed the astonishment when people hold and hear them. Help us pass this on.

column4: >                Voxos Smartglasses connects with your mobile device via Bluetooth and transfers its sound while leaving your ears free and keeping you off your phone screen.
column8: >The integrated Bone Conduction technology transfers the sound by vibrating the skull. Compared to in-ear headphones the ears stay completely free, enabling a safe way of staying connected while on the go.

column3: >Maybe no the right sound? Swipe to change the track

column3: >Get directions without looking at your phone screen
column9: >The integrated touchzone is setup to access everything without ever taking the phone out of your pocket. Connectivity at the touch of a button. Consuming digital information on the go is a form of distraction but with Voxos it becomes part of the human senses.
column18: >Bone Conduction - the process by which sound waves are transmitted to the inner ear by the cranial bones without traveling through the air in the ear canal.
column19: >The bone conduction system offers key safety advantages over traditional earphones, by leaving the user's ears “free” so that they are not distracted from their environment.
column26: >We'll provide you with the type of lense you need, chose from the following options.
column34: >Apart from launching a device that is fashionable and can be used by anyone that wants to stay connected while on the go, the team at Voxos is also focussed on making a difference and having an impact by working with organisations in different areas.
column35: >We have partnered with Hearology, a company that is redefining the ‘Audiology’ industry, to identify how we can help patients with hearing deficiencies. Together we have seen how Voxos provides relief to people with Tinnitus, a condition experienced by 5% of the global adult population.

column5: >No need to worry about running out of power during the course of the day. Voxos Smartglasses will provide you with battery for up to 10 hours and only requires 2 hours charging time.
column9: >Don’t be conditioned by the weather. May it be rain, sweat, dust, dirt or anything else, Voxos can be used in any situation and in any location.
column12: >Voxos has been tested by many users and a universal fit has been developed. Based on the feedback of customers using other products and complaining about a ""too tight fit"", we made this one of our top priorities and created a true “one size fits all”.
column17: >Voxos is completely developed and ready for mass production. Compared to many other campaigns we commit to our production starting immediately after the Indiegogo campaign has ended.

Compared to in-ear headphones the ears stay completely free, enabling a safe way of staying connected while on the go.  Accept an incoming call - swipe backwards Turn on your music with One Tap

column1: Maybe no the right sound? Swipe to change the track   How does your day look? Press the touchzone for 2 seconds and ask Siri/Google/Bixby

Get directions without looking at your phone screen    The integrated touchzone is setup to access everything without ever taking the phone out of your pocket. Connectivity at the touch of a button. Consuming digital information on the go is a form of distraction but with Voxos it becomes part of the human senses.    Bone Conduction - the process by which sound waves are transmitted to the inner ear by the cranial bones without traveling through the air in the ear canal.The bone conduction system offers key safety advantages over traditional earphones, by leaving the user's ears “free” so that they are not distracted from their environment.   We'll provide you with the type of lense you need, chose from the following options.    Apart from launching a device that is fashionable and can be used by anyone that wants to stay connected while on the go, the team at Voxos is also focussed on making a difference and having an impact by working with organisations in different areas.We have partnered with Hearology, a company that is redefining the ‘Audiology’ industry, to identify how we can help patients with hearing deficiencies. Together we have seen how Voxos provides relief to people with Tinnitus, a condition experienced by 5% of the global adult population.

10 H BATTERY LIFE No need to worry about running out of power during the course of the day. Voxos Smartglasses will provide you with battery for up to 10 hours and only requires 2 hours charging time. WATER/WEATHER RESISTANTDon’t be conditioned by the weather. May it be rain, sweat, dust, dirt or anything else, Voxos can be used in any situation and in any location. UNIVERSAL FITVoxos has been tested by many users and a universal fit has been developed. Based on the feedback of customers using other products and complaining about a ""too tight fit"", we made this one of our top priorities and created a true “one size fits all”.  Voxos is completely developed and ready for mass production. Compared to many other campaigns we commit to our production starting immediately after the Indiegogo campaign has ended.  Light weight and classic design - made for everyday life    Cycling Working Commuting Driving Working out  Walking  Voxos box, user instructions, USB charging cable, fabric bag, Voxos Smartglasses (incl. high quality lenses), microfiber cloth and protective case    We went out to play sound through people's bones. See their reactions.
We will ship Voxos Smartglasses worldwide.No matter where you are we will get a pair to you!",48.0,3,"1 Campaign
