Check out this review from Flossy Carter!
column3:
showinfo=0"">
 
 

Add Hi-Fi Sound to your everyday carry. Or rather, let Hi-Fi sound carry all your everyday items.

Share the gift of music anywhere. From beach bonfires, backyard hangs, and spontaneous dance parties, the Speaker Backpack was made to protect the vibe.

No need to lug around large speakers with you. Carry powerful Hi-Fi sound with your everyday carry wherever you go. 

Speaker Backpack weighs only 5lbs! That means you get insanely powerful sound without the crazy weight.

Our 5000mHA Lithium-Ion Rechargeable Battery gives you a whopping 5-6 hours of playback time.

When it’s drained, you can quickly and easily recharge the battery via USB.

We also added built-in charging cords for iPhone and Android phones, so you can charge your phone up to two full cycles!

Getting the party started is as easy as turning the volume up.

Speaker Backpack is has simple, intuitive controls.

To turn on the speakers, simply rotate the volume dial till it “clicks” on, sync your device, and party away! Increase the volume by rotating the dial even more.

Speaker Backpack is also water resistant. No need to worry about spilled drinks or a questionable overcast day. Enjoy the scene without a drop of worry.

We made sure to make Speaker Backpack a fully functional backpack with enough storage space to carry all your everyday essentials plus more.​

There’s open space for your large items and internal pockets to compartmentalize your specifics - such as your laptop.

With 12L of storage space, you’ll be able to stash your laptop, notebook, pens, water bottle, jacket, and more!​

No one likes pickpockets going through their stuff. That’s why we designed Speaker Backpack with Theft Protection features.​

Our pocket zippers, including the main compartment zipper, are fully hidden in the back of the backpack - preventing any passing thief from picking through your bag pockets.

Plus, a secret pocket behind the bag will keep thieves from finding your most valuable items to begin with.

We included internal pockets with zippers and velcro straps to make it easy to compartmentalize your items. The laptop pocket can fit a laptop up to 15”, while the zipper pocket makes it easy to store smaller items without losing them.

Need to store your phone while it charges? Speaker Backpack has a secret stash pocket in the back that makes it easy for you to access your most valuable essentials while keeping pickpockets from reaching or finding them.

The built-in charging cords are also stashed in this pocket, so you can charge your devices in safety without anyone knowing.

Speaker Backpack’s award winning Patent-Pending Ridge Sleek Design is a new, innovative modern concept for backpacks. There’s nothing like it out there.

Turn heads as you stay ahead of design trends and get in with the cutting-edge crowd.

Not only is Speaker Backpack good-looking, we made sure it was comfortable to wear.

Our straps and back sections are padded with Extra-Comfort Performance Mesh to make sure your Speaker Backpack fits snug and comfortable when you’re on the go. 

Speaker Backpack’s shell is made of an EVA foam with a nylon exterior covering - giving you a unique strong &
column4:
lightweight combination.

The foam shell provides a firm structure and protective barrier around your items and speakers without being overly rigid.

The nylon cover increases durability and gives the shell a soft-to-touch surface.

Together, the foam and nylon make Speaker Backpack ultra-tough as well as comfortable to carry and easy to handle.

With Speaker Backpack, you can turn any area into your next kickback or full out rager. Carry your music with all your essentials, turn up the beat, and dance away.

You’ll not just be the life of the party, you’ll be the ultimate music ambassador wherever you go.

""PUGZ are the world's first wireless earphones that lets you charge them through your phone. Plus you can listen and charge at the same time. We are strong believers that this simplifies the wireless experience and is a crucial key component for the adaptation of wireless earphones. You don't want a pair of earphones that go useless when they run out of battery. Imagine a phone with no ""listen and charge"" functionality?

column6:
s=684eb12ca666c910006d7fa55497edf7"" src="""" style=""""/>

 


The key differentiator in PUGZ earphones UX is our patented self guiding magnetic connector we call: ""The Squircle"". For the best electrical conductivity and styling, we chose this in 18 K Gold.
column8: >The Squircle enables you to listen and charge at the same time. This is something the industry had forgot, but we know we can fix.

column2:
>






When choosing between SEALED and LEAKING it all comes down to pure taste. Sealed provides you with a passive noise cancellation that isolates all surrounding noise and lets you focus on your music experience. Leaking on the other hand directs the audio into your ears but allow you to hear your surroundings. 





PUGZ is compatible with all your devices with Bluetooth such as mobile phone, computer, tablet, TV, Apple Watch, etc. Just pair it and enjoy!
column5:
>







Training is all about freedom! You want to be free! You don't want cords and wires to tangle and limit your movement. At least we don't! Thats why we built PUGZ for extreme perfect fit, sweat, rain, wear and tear. They are designed and constructed to simply stay in place. We defy you to try shaking them out of your ears!
column9:
>'
Just place your phone next to you and never have to worry about the cord interrupting your workout session

column2: >

column1: The PUGZ team consists of techies and designers that are passionate about creating useful products for the world to enjoy! For years we've created solutions for the mobile and tech industry and sometimes notice that the most obvious demands are not fulfilled, so now it's time we do something about it. We are finally ready to present our puppies to the world.
What is included with the PUGZ earphone?
column4:
>One charging cable - One USB-converter so you can charge through your laptop or wall outlet. - 3 pairs of ear tips in assorted sizes. - 3 pairs of secure wings

Can I use the earphones with other devices than my phone? 
You can charge your PUGZ earphones on devices such as computer (USB), AC-adapter (USB), Micro-USB(
column7:
>Android).

How much battery does a full charge use up?
column10:
>A full charge uses 3% of your smartphones battery capacity. And with a full charge you get 4,5h of active days of usage and 10 days of standby. If the battery happens to run out while you're using them all you do is: attach the cord and keep on listening. All that while you're charging.

Does the volume control on the earbuds control the phone volume directly or an internal amplifier?
column13:
>You only need to adjust one volume. The volume on your buds and your phone will be synced.

What is the sound like?
column16:
>Sound is very subjective but trust us when we say: we are super audio freaks. Just to give you an idea: we use an codec in our CSR-BT chip called aptX®. Also known for revolutionising he Bluetooth Stereo listening experience. Quote from there website: ""pure wireless sound that doesn’t compromise on audio quality."" 

How long is the warranty?
column20:
it covers any manufacturer issues. This warranty covers the repair and replacement of any defective material or component. 

What is the bluetooth range?
column23:
>Bluetooth range is 10-30 m depending on your surrounding environment.

Can I use the earphones with other devices than my mobile? 
Yes. With all devices that support bluetooth! 

How long is the charging cable? 
The charging cable is about 1,0 m (3,5 feet).  

Are the earphones durable?
Yes. We do systematic durability tests. We pull, drop, scratch, water etc during the testing and quality assurance phase just to ensure that they live up to the high quality standards. However there will be limitations to what they can withstand. The buds are also Sweat Proof and live up to a very high industry standard, so called IP64. In terms of whether conditions: here are the heat specs. Conditions: 60 ±3°C with 50±15% RH (full performance). Duration: 1 h ramp, Functionality check after 2 hours at set temperature and new function test after 1 h at HH temp. Meaning your only concern is what music your listening to.

Small and lightweight portable guitar—Klang.

Musicians and guitar enthusiasts would have dreamed of a conveniently small and lightweight portable instrument that can be taken anywhere and used whenever the desire to play should appear.

Here is how to make your dreams come true with compact and portable Klang guitars. 

  • Klang discards the usual acoustic guitar tuning method in exchange for smaller, lightweight tuning pins that decrease the overall weight and create Klang’s unique design. 

  • Klang is a headless guitar that discards conventional standards.  In order to improve portability, we have adopted a design that gets rid of a standard guitar head with  tuning machines, minimizing the overall length of the instrument. 

  • Klang is a solid body instrument made from mahogany.  Measuring 620mm from neck to sound box, this small but precise instrument is carefully crafted to fill the role of a full-sized guitar.

  • The various unique design features have allowed us to create a lightweight instrument with a total weight of 550-grams.  This low weight allows Klang to faithfully fill its role as a portable instrument, allows players to perform on it for an extended time without strain, and is sure to become a precious friend you can always have by your side.

  • Klang is a faithful instrument, fulfilling its role as a guitar in all aspects.  It is constructed to accurately produce the full-range of sound necessary for performance with 18-frets.  Narrow fret widths resulting from a 510mm scale make it   a convenient instrument for women and children as well.

  • Klang’s exclusive case protects the instrument with ample padding and quality craftsmanship. The adjustable shoulder strap makes it convenient to go anywhere with your instrument.

  • Klang portable guitars were conceived and designed by a Korean specialty instrument maker. In 2016, Klang received 120,000 USD in contributions on a Korean funding site Tumblebug, allowing for the production and distribution of 650 instruments.

  • There are two ways to play.  First, seated playing—supporting the instrument between your right hip and leg, you can play Klang in the same way you would play a normal guitar. 

​

  • You can also play standing up.  Adjust the strap to your body type, find a comfortable position, and you’re ready to go.

 

Contents

instrument, soft bag, tuning wrench, strap, pickup(equiped)

 

Detail spec

 

FAQ

  • Is there a classical guitar model?

We are currently developing a new model.  The nylon string model is set to be released soon.

  • Can I play Klang in the same way I would play an acoustic guitar?

Since it is structurally the same as a regular guitar, there are no major differences in the way you would play it.

  • Will first-time learners of the guitar be able to use Klang?

Even if it’s your first time touching a guitar or learning how to play, practice will be enough.

  • Can I also use nylon strings?

Yes, you can use nylon strings, but it is not recommended.

  •  What kind of guitar strings should I use?

You can use any kind of acoustic guitar strings sold at music stores. 

  • Is it possible to connect Klang to an amp through the pick-up?

Klang’s pick-up is designed to work with your smartphone.  Using it with an amplifier can cause feedback, so it is not recommended.

Klang’s supplementary pickup is meant for output or recording through a smartphone. 

A mobile interface is required to utilize these functions.  

The interface featured in the video was the I-Rig 2 mobile interface.  

You may use this or other similar interfaces.

  • Can I order a left-handed Klang?

Unfortunately, completing orders for left-handed instruments is not possible.

  • How does Klang create its sound?  How loud can it be?

Klang is small, but since it has a sound box it produces a proper acoustic guitar tone.  Therefore, you might not be able to hear it in a noisy environment.

  • Can I use Klang in concerts?

Klang has been carefully designed for portability.  Although the instrument has everything a guitar should have, it does lack certain strengths desired by live performers.

  • Is there a money-back guarantee?

The satisfaction guarantee lasts six months.  However, in the case consumer error additional charges may be incurred.  The buyer will be responsible for return shipping fees.

  • Is it possible to cancel my order?

It is possible to cancel your order during the funding period.  However, once the funding period and processing are complete, cancellation is no longer possible.

  • I don’t know how to play the instrument!!!

A manual will be enclosed with your order.

Please be aware that connecting the Klang pickup with general speakers can result in feedback and low-quality output

 

Rewards

 

Early bird package

Bulk package

Single package

Bulk double

Double package

 

About me

making at the young age of 26, Dong-jin Jo studied for two years under a classical guitar Meister before opening a small workshop in Seoul, Korea.  Now, it has been six years perfecting his craft and interacting with musicians around Hongdae, the long-time musical hub of Seoul’s arts scene. Carrying his instruments along with all his other interests, he is walking the path of a true artisan.

A New Generation of Wireless Speakers

Trippy is a wireless speaker with Place and Play™ technology. This means that you can forget about annoying cables and Bluetooth. Just play music on your phone and place it on Trippy - the sound is transmitted through magnetic induction. 

  

Trippy connects automatically to any phone that is placed on the speaker. 

 

 

      

Our vision was to create a seamless way of transferring music from phone to speaker. We wanted to save you the frustration of failing connection - turning Bluetooth on and off repeatedly. With Trippy, using your speaker will never again be harder than just placing your phone on top of it.

Trippy's Place and Play™ technology does not require any pairing. Just press play and put your phone on the speaker.

We call the technology Place and Play™. Utilizing four strategically placed magnetic inductors, Trippy can read the electromagnetic fields generated around your phone’s internal speaker, and transmit them as conventional electric signals to Trippy´s sound system. It is science, but it feels like magic.


 

Pick your favorite song and place the phone on Trippy

Place and Play™ is based on electromagnetic induction and Faraday´s law. These physical phenomena describe the interplay between magnetic fields and electric currents. An electric current will always create a magnetic field that shifts depending on the strength and direction of the current. A changing magnetic field, on the other hand, will create an electric current in a so called inductor. This interplay makes both electric engines and the production of electricity at power plants possible.

Faraday's law - How shifting magnetic fields induce electric currents

Almost all electronics, including speakers, transmit signals as electric impulses. This means that every time you are playing a song, it is reduced to a multitude of electric impulses. When music is playing on your phone, every electric impulse creates a magnetic field.

When placed on Trippy, these constantly shifting magnetic fields will induce an electric signal in the sensors. This electric signal is identical to the one that was sent to the phone´s internal speaker when you pressed play. Now the signal is sent to Trippy´s sound system instead, and you can enjoy your music loud and clear.
column4: '>Sensors inside Trippy transmit the music from your phone to the speaker itself, thus connecting your music to the speaker in the most seamless way possible.
column6:
'/>

We wanted to redefine the speaker as a social focal point, around which family and friends can gather to seamlessly share their music with each other. Switching whose song is playing will never again be harder than just lifting one phone off, and placing yours on instead.
column8:
'>Do you think it´s your turn to choose a song? Just take your friend´s phone off and place yours on instead.

Forget about the awkward silence when everyone at a party is waiting for someone's phone to establish a Bluetooth connection. Never again get frustrated because the connection keeps failing. Focus on what is important: Your friends and the music.

Varning for fights over whose music will be playing.

Choosing music at your parties will get more democratic than ever before. Instead of a designated playlist provider, that connected his or her phone at the beginning of a party, anyone can simply place their phone on Trippy. 

Trippy is perfect for picnics, the beach, or any other getaway

Trippy´s design is true to its Scandinavian heritage. The minimalistic design is complimented by elegant material choices. We chose carbonated bamboo for its slightly darker and sophisticated aesthetics, and the cloth comes in different colors, so that you can find your favorite. 

We have worked long and hard on perfecting the look that you can see on Trippy today. The speaker is designed to feel just as natural in a formal office, at a beach or at a rooftop party. 

Trippy comes in different colors, all with the same distinctive look.

Great attention has been put into the details of Trippy. We wanted the design to be not only stylish but also functional. This is why everything with Trippy, the slanting design included, is made to accommodate the function of the speaker and make your use as seamless as possible.

Trippy is carefully designed with high quality materials. The slanting shape is at a perfect angle to place your phone.

The opening on the side of the speaker is part of the acoustic chambers, enhancing the sound from the drums.

Our choice of bamboo as material was motivated by both acoustics and the environment. We wanted to create a speaker that was better, more sustainable and more aesthetically appealing than conventional ones in plastic or metal.

Bamboo is traditionally used all over the world in manufacturing musical instruments, due to its outstanding acoustic properties.

Contrary to what you might think, bamboo is technically a grass and not a tree. This makes it super-fast growing (up to 1 meter a day!) and thus one of the most environmentally friendly materials available. In addition, bamboo has great acoustic properties, making it a preferred material for instrument manufacturing all across the globe. It was a given choice for Trippy!

column1:
The idea for a new generation of wireless speakers was born gradually, at university and while traveling the world. During countless get-togethers with new and old friends at parties, dinners and rooftops, we discovered the need for a new type of speaker that could change streaming devices seamlessly, in order to allow greater interaction around the music. This idea grew to a pursuit to redefine the very function of wireless speakers and how we interact around them.

We merged our pursuit with a passion for design, and worked long and hard to build the perfect speaker. The result is a speaker that we proudly display in our own apartments and that will be a great companion at your parties and travels, as well as a much appreciated design element in your home. 

Thanks to the founders´ professional experience of production in China, Trippy could be developed in cooperation with the very best developers and producers in Chinese Shenzhen - the world´s epicenter for manufacturing electronics. During the development and sampling process we visited the involved factories regularly in order to ensure that our vision was brought to life in the exact way we envisioned.

During the course of the campaign, we partnered up with a marketing firm that assisted us with the graphical material used in the campaign. Above are various photos from the production of our Kickstarter video. In the middle picture, the founders are having a short break between the shots. Co-founder Erik is getting some makeup by the producer after several hours in the spotlight. 

Trippy disassembled with its components visible: the circuit board, the magnetic induction sensors, the speaker drums and the battery. Notice how the sensors have been paired into bundles to reduce disturbing noise otherwise caused by interfering electronic signals. Another interesting detail is that in order to attach the fabric on the speaker drums, we had to cover the drums with a customized metal mesh as seen in the picture above.

Above is a selection of different speaker cloth that we experimented with during the development phase of Trippy. The challenge we faced when choosing speaker cloth was to find organic fabrics that matched the aesthetics of the bamboo casing. Another important aspect was that the fabric had to be transparent enough not to affect the sound quality.

The development of the Trippy switch. We started out with a standard plastic switch but quickly decided we wanted something more robust with an exclusive feel to it. After testing various metal switches, we decided on a classic square-shaped metal switch as seen in the picture to the far right. 

Hou​sings in different materials were tested before we finally decided for the natural carbonized bamboo look

An early sample of Trippy´s bamboo housing is experimented with in order to find the best solution for air tightening the speaker chambers

HPSD E70 is able to play a delicate and high-resolution sound that is differentiated from previous technologies, because we have invented the Magneto-Static Driver which has an innovative vibration structure that did not exist before.
column3: >
column6: >The key to EARBRIDGE sound playback technology is to share
column7: >the real sense of the Scene as it is.
column9:
> 

 

 

MagnetoStatic Driver’s surprisingly thin and light diaphragm called Radial Wings Membrane helps the earphones deliver more nature, detailed and accurate sound through its radial, wing-like structure in the middle.

 

 

 

 

 

When electrical energy is delivered to MagnetoStatic Hybrid Driver, the MagnetoStatic Driver’s Radial Wings Membrane vibrates in very high speed reproducing detailed and accurate sounds. And, what’s penetrating through those sounds are the deep and rich lows generated by the Twin Magnet System Deep Bass Driver.

As the Hybrid Driver applied to E70 emits sound to the same same axis and the sound sources of the two speakers are very close, the low-range and high-range sound naturally blend without any interruption of phase, allowing a wide range of sounds to be played precisely and harmoniously.
column10:
>

 

 

 

The Electro-static Earphone which has the technology of high resolution, is powered by an electrostatic force and is operated by an auxiliary amplifier, which seems to be inconvenient to carry.

But, E70 is powered by a Magneto-Static force and is operated by the output of portable audio without the need for an auxiliary amplifier, making it easy to carry.

If you have chosen E70 to listen to high-resolution sound, you no longer need to purchase or carry a separate auxiliary amplifier.

 

The electro-static speaker is a capacity reactance, and the EARBRIDGE magnetic static speaker is a inductive reactance.

Electrostatic systems have high impedance at low frequency Preventive measures are needed because the efficiency is low, high voltage bias circuits are needed, and negative distortion, loss and noise may occur. Increasing voltage or reducing the gap between vibration plates increases efficiency, and controlling the compliance can expand the bass, but be careful that the vibration plate is damaged by the discharge.

The magneto-static speaker of the EARBRIDGE is low impedance, efficient, and magnetic force is used as a bias, so it operates at low voltage and does not require a separate boost circuit.
column12: '>
column14:
'>

The 70 package offers a wire strap with permanent magnets. Wire straps are easier to use when wrapping earphone wires, attaching them to refrigerators, whiteboards, or collars, or adjusting wire lengths.

We hope that you will find it more pleasant with this new configuration that was not available in existing earphones.
column15:
>

The E70 package includes the Indigo Limited Edition Pelican case.

The inside of the pelican case contains a specially tailored buffer for the E70, and it is very hard and waterproof, so it will keep the product safer for a longer period of time
column16:
>

 

 

 

 

There are a lot of people in the world who make earphones and headphones. And they all try their best to reproduce the best sound. 

We are also one of them who are deeply in love with sound and are committed to producing the best sound that is closest to the original sound.

We started this project in a small room located in Incheon, Korea.

We had always wanted a more evolved new structure, and in the end we were able to approach the unique method of making an ultra-thin and light diaphragm to self-operate.

We named this new technology as Magneto-Static, and after spending 1,500 days of planning, designing and having the theory, structure, sound quality and mass production verified, we could finally release this technology to you.

The Magneto-Static technology is operated with low power, which allows to play delicate sound, and the earphones applied with this technology have the features that allows you to assemble and disassemble yourself.

From now on, we are trying to offer you a premium earphone that is excellent in playing live music

We hope that our E70, the earphones we created can play the best sound that will satisfy you.

We also hope you will sincerely support the E70, the outcome of our sincere effort.

column18:
>

You are a drummer with or without drumkit? Perfect we are drummers too and made special features for you.
You want to start drumming ? Awesome, we can help you ! 
Just read our page bellow to understand how we can facilitate your life
column4:
>Last update : enjoy this little demonstration of our sensors (Senstroke).

Available in September
column8:
>

Drumistic is a little product that will revolutionize drumming.

This new connected solution which offers incredible precision (Drumsticks movements, hitting zones, drumstick impact…) will let you :

column1: • #1 Drum whenever and wherever you want
• #2 Easily record yourself and export your playing sessions in different formats
• #3 Make progress with interactive, personalized lessons

With Drumistic you'll get a free complete interactive app for drummers too!

 In the media
column3:
>

#1 PLAY 

Each time your drumsticks hit your hitting zones, you’ll hear the sound of a real drum.

You can emulate the sound of a drum from your smartphone,  tablet and your actual music software (MacOs and Windows)

We’ll be developing dozens of new kits for our sound bank in the coming months.
column4: >
column8:
'>#2 RECORD

Instantly take advantage of detailed recordings of your playing directly from the application.

Who hasn’t wished they could record their drumming performance in just 2 clicks?
Your recording will be exportable as sound files, midi files.

Each of your recordings can be directly transcribed into sheet music. No more need to write sheet music by hand!
column9:
>

#3 IMPROVE

Drumistic comes with hundreds of exercises that help you improve your drumming.

Simply start your exercise, and play! In real-time, verify that you’re on beat, that you’re hitting the accents correctly, etc… After each exercise, take advantage of personalized tips on areas of improvement.

Thanks to Drumistic, you’ll be able to improve your drumming. You can even follow and share your progress.
column12:
>

Drumistic is a concentrated pack of patented technologies

To take advantage of the Drumistic experience, all you need is a smartphone (or tablet), Drumistic sensors, and a pair of drumsticks.

In less than 30 seconds connect the sensors to your smartphone (or tablet) via wireless BLUETOOTH technology and take advantage of our incredible features.
column14:
>

Drumistic was made for EVERYONE

#1 Beginners, new drummers... are you on your way to lesson? Or up late at school and don't want to wake anyone up? Pull your sticks out and practice!

#2 Already got a drum kit? You can analyse what you're doing, your accuracy and record yourself

#3 Guitarists... you can accompany yourself with drums or midi on your feet

You want to drum but you’ve never had enough space for a drumset where you live? You’ve never touched drumsticks in your life, but you’ve got the itch ? You’re scared that your neighbors might have a problem with the noise? You’ve had enough of practicing on pads? You want to liven up your playing with some new sounds? You want to progress? You want to share your parts and compositions?

There’s a long list of possibilities! Drumistic is sure to change your life.

Drumistic breaks all the barriers of drumming practice and makes your drumsticks come alive! Your drumsticks will be totally interactive.

Each drummer is unique with a drumming setup and length or diameter of drumsticks that work best for them.
It’s perfect : Drumistic adapts to you. 

In this small, ultra light, and compact device, you’ll find the advantages of acoustic drumming and electronics, and enjoy an unequaled interactive experience.

column1:
Drumistic ? C’est quoi ?

Drumistic est un petit produit qui va révolutionner le monde de la batterie. Que vous soyez débutant, confirmé ou professionnel, Drumistic a été fait pour répondre à vos besoins en s’adaptant à vos habitudes de jeu.

Ce nouveau produit connecté va vous permettre de :
- Jouer de la batterie n’importe où et n’importe quand
- Vous enregistrer très facilement et exporter vos sessions de jeu sous différents formats
- Progresser via des cours interactifs personnalisés

Drumistic offre une précision incroyable et restituera à l’identique votre jeu (mouvements des baguettes, zones de frappes, impact des baguettes…)

OK… mais ça marche comment ? 

Drumistic est un concentré de technologies brevetées.

Pour profiter de l’expérience Drumistic, il vous suffit de posséder un smartphone (ou tablette), de capteurs Drumistic et d’une paire de baguettes.

En moins de 30 secondes connectez les capteurs à votre smartphone (ou tablette) via la technologie BLUETOOTH (donc sans fil) et profitez de nos fonctionnalités incroyables.

Que puis-je faire avec Drumistic ?

PLAY Une fois que vous aurez défini votre environnement de jeu (position et orientation de vos zones de frappes), vous aurez la possibilité d’émuler le son d’une batterie depuis votre smartphone ou tablette.

A chaque impact de vos baguettes sur vos zones de frappes, vous aurez le plaisir d’entendre le son d’une vraie batterie. Notre banque de son va se développer dans les mois à venir avec des dizaines de nouveaux kits. 


RECORD
Qui n’a jamais souhaité pouvoir enregistrer en 2 clicks ses performances à la batterie ?
Fini la pose et le réglage fastidieux des micros ou de capteurs midi, grâce à Drumistic, profitez instantanément d’un enregistrement fidèle de votre jeu dans l’application.
Votre enregistrement sera exportable sous fichier sonore ou fichier midi pour une utilisation dans les logiciels de MAO.
Cerise sur le gâteau, chacun de vos enregistrements pourra également être directement retranscrit en partition.
Qui a dit qu’il était long de rédiger des partitions à la batterie ?

IMPROVE
Drumistic intègre des centaines d’exercices afin de vous faire progresser à la batterie.

Lancez votre exercice et jouez ! En temps réel, vérifiez que vous êtes bien dans le tempo, que vous respectez bien les accents etc…
A l’issue de chaque exercice, profitez de conseils personnalisés sur vos pistes d’amélioration. 

Grâce à Drumistic vous allez pouvoir devenir meilleur à la batterie. Vous pourrez suivre et partager votre progression.

Est-ce que Drumistic est fait pour moi ?

Drumistic a été pensé et conçu pour TOUS les batteurs.

Vous souhaitez faire de la batterie mais vous n’avez pas la place chez vous? Vous n’avez jamais touché de baguettes de votre vie mais cela vous démange ? Vous avez peur de vous lancer par crainte du bruit pour le voisinage ? Vous en avez assez de jouer sur des pads d’entrainements ? Vous voulez agrémenter votre jeu de batteur avec de nouveaux sons? Vous souhaitez progresser ? Vous voulez partager vos partitions et compositions ? … 

La liste des possibilités est longue ! Que vous soyez simple débutant ou professionnel, Drumistic vous changera la vie.

Pourquoi Drumistic est une révolution?

Nous avons imaginé et créé un dispositif qui supprime toutes les barrières de la pratique de la batterie et vous permet de rendre interactif tout ce que vous toucherez avec vos baguettes.

Chaque batteur est unique, possède sa propre configuration de batterie et des baguettes d’une longueur et d’un diamètre qui lui convient le mieux. C’est parfait : Drumistic s’adapte à vous.

Retrouvez dans un dispositif ultra léger, compact, les avantages des batteries acoustiques et électroniques et profitez d’une expérience interactive inégalée jusqu’à aujourd’hui.

Est-ce que mon smartphone est compatible ?

Nous avons développé notre application pour IOS (10.0 et supérieur) et l’avons rendu compatible Android (6 ou supérieur).

La partie PLAY est encore en développement sous les terminaux Android, la latence doit être encore affinée. Ceci est un problème connu par Android qui travaille en ce moment à améliorer les choses. Les fonctionnalités RECORD et IMPROVE sont déjà 100% compatible Android!

La version Windows phone arrive très bientôt! 

Que vais-je recevoir? 

Nous avons essayé de vous proposer une grande diversité de packs afin de répondre à toutes les utilisations de Drumistic.

Dans le pack Découverte
Retrouvez un lot de 2 Drumistic (2 boitiers électroniques + 2 fixations baguettes / pédales + 1 câble micro USB)

Dans le pack Standard
Retrouvez 4 lots de Drumistic (4 boitiers électroniques + 4 fixations baguettes / pédales + 2 fixations pour les pieds + 2 câbles micro USB)

Dans le pack Plus Retrouvez 5 lots de Drumistic (5 boitiers électroniques + 5 fixations baguettes / pédales + 2 fixations pour les pieds + 2 câbles micro USB)

Qui est derrière le projet?

L’équipe de Drumistic est composée à 100% de musiciens et de batteurs confirmés. 

Nous avons mutualisé nos compétences en Design, Electronique et Développement pour réussir à concrétiser notre vision et pouvoir démocratiser la batterie. 

Nous avons également fait appel à des batteurs professionnels afin de proposer le meilleur produit qu’il soit.
Ce produit a été conçu par des batteurs pour des batteurs.

Qu’en pensent les batteurs?

""Amis batteurs et percussionnistes: Drumistic à suivre de très près !""
Max Catteloin - Skip the Use, The NoFace, #MakeMeSound 

« Un seul outil pour jouer, apprendre et s'enregistrer ? Drumistic promet de devenir le nouveau meilleur ami du batteur »
Sébastien Benoits - Rédacteur en chef Batterie Magazine

« Une belle invention qui ouvre de nouvelles perspectives pédagogiques et créatives aux batteurs/percussionnistes »
Marc Rouvé - Directeur de la publication de Batteur Mag'

« Drumistic révolutionne l'idée du batteur toujours portant sa batterie sur le dos, avec votre invention il sera plus facile à un batteur de se déplacer qu'à un harmoniciste ou un flutiste »
Olivier Eynaud de Faÿ – Compositeur arrangeur

« Utile pour rentrer des parties de batteries midi dans le train
column2:
-) »
Meivelyan Jacquot - Musicien professionnel

« Waouh ! Mais c'est de la magie ? Je rêve ou bien ? »
Anthony Dupies - batteur débutant

« Pour moi qui suis professeur de Batterie, Drumistic sera un outil ultra intéressant, je vais gagner des heures de travail !! »
Cédric Mells - professeur de Batterie

« Ça va me permettre d'enregistrer des partie de batterie sans avoir la batterie, le pc et la carte son. C’est génial »
Tony Caracciolo – Batteur professionnel

Quelles sont les prochaines étapes ? 

Début du projet : Mars 2015
Premier prototype : Février 2016
Première application smartphone: Septembre 2016
Prototype fonctionnel : Décembre 2016
Design : Janvier 2017
Finalisation de l’électronique et de l’application : Septembre 2017
Test finaux : Décembre 2017
Production : Février 2018
Expédition : Mars 2018

  

Vous aimez Drumistic ?

column1: After three years of continuous development, the Grid is finally ready for action. Throughout the years we developed a number of different prototypes, iterating on the design until we found the perfect solution. We believe that Grid brings a new perspective to creative controllers.

Grid features a unique X-Y mapping, with absolute and relative modes. Your control surface can be easily reconfigured at any time, even while playing live. Each position and even rotation of the modules can indicate a new mapping.

The control surface creates a seamless tactile user interface. The buttons and potentiometers are evenly spaced in a 1.05"" * 1.05"" (2.7 cm * 2.7 cm) array. This makes the Grid easy to play while also keeping it very portable.  We believe that Grid represents the perfect balance between modularity, usability and component density.
As your needs can change, Grid was designed to pick up your pace. You can easily down and upscale your control surface. Playing together with friends makes the Grid even more exciting.

All of the user interface components are carefully selected for superior electrical performance and mechanical reliability. We use the USB Type-C connector because it offers better power capability,  convenient reversibility and guaranteed 10,000 mating cycles.

Grid modules interconnect through a custom designed magnetic interface. The spring loaded connectors are designed for maximum reliability. The gold plating on the connectors allows them to be resistant to corrosion.

The new conductive plastic technology pontentiometers and linear faders in the PO16 and PBF4 modules are rated for 100,000 cycles, while the Omron buttons in the BO16 and PBF4 modules are rated for 3,000,000 cycles.

Grid modules offer unmatched control possibilities. We already implemented midi channel and control number settings, control change and note messages, 7-bit and 14-bit resolution (NRPN),  toggle, momentary and step modes.

Grid will also support user defined sysex packets allowing the Grid to control hardware synthesizers and other MIDI gear. The editor is currently in development and we would like to involve you in the final touches. Both the editor &

Grid by default sends MIDI over USB, it’s compatible with all MIDI capable application. Our mission is to create an extremely versatile and easy-to-use control surface at the same time. We already tested Grid with popular music software like Ableton, Bitwig, FL Studio and Traktor Pro. The array of available custom scripts for creative applications will only expand.
Grid can even be used with mobile devices and tablets using the correct USB OTG adapter.

Once you receive your Grid modules, we will provide templates and the control scripts for various software, quick start guide and manual. These will be available online as free download. We will publish an open hub once the modules are shipped. You will be able to share your own scripts, templates and stay up-to-date with our future software releases.

Take a sneak peak into the assembly model of the Grid module P016. It's modular both inside and outside. Re-using this design is straight forward, this is why we say Grid's sustainable modular variations are endless.

Grid modules are 4.2"" (10.7 cm) wide, allowing them to be mounted in a standard 3U Eurorack modular case. We are already working on ANA4 which allows the Grid modules to be directly connected to analog synthesizers and 5-pin DIN MIDI gear. Check out our video from SUPERBOOTH 18 for a sneak peek of what is to come!
Using a USB MIDI to 5-pin DIN MIDI adapter, Grid can control hardware synth or MIDI gear.
The following videos have been recorded during the pre-launch preparations,

In the first video Kristóf played an Ableton live set using three Grid controllers. As the live set evolves, so does the control surface. The PBF4  was used for main channel mixing, PO16 for controlling envelopes and effects and BO16 for launching midi clips and loops. If you are interested how we made the Ableton set, check out the walk-through video.

The second video is a snippet from a DJ set, using Native Instrument's Traktor Pro 2 and two Grid controllers. The PO16 module was used as a 4-band equalizer and effect control for two decks and PBF4 as one-knob filter, headphone and main out mixer. If you are interested how we made the Traktor mapping check out the walk-through video.
• USB 2.0 compliant composite device (HID Midi, CDC Serial, DFU Bootloader)
• Compatible with Windows, Mac and Linux (No drivers needed)
• Support for major DAWs and music software
• Tactile user interface featuring long life components

""So you want to create your ideal MIDI controller, but don't want to go DIY and would rather have a system where each module fits together and looks really great? Say hello to GRID from Intech Studios."" - Ask Audio
""The three starting modules are great choices. You can easily see how you would use them and arrange them for controlling all sorts of stuff."" - Gearnews
""Not only are the Grid modules modular, but you can re-arrange them on the fly, and they’ll adapt automatically to their new context."" - Synthtopia
""According to Intech, one of the ideas behind Grid is to blur the line between software and hardware control."" - AudioNewsRoom

The Grid already works. Now our number one priority is to start the tooling process as soon as possible. Once we are happy with the enclosure, we can focus on the PCB Assembly and testing. Finalizing the firmware and the software components is the last piece of the puzzle.

Launching the first three modules is just the beginning of the journey. We will use our tools and manufacturing chain to create new modules. Most of the firmware and the hardware designs can also be reused, further reducing the development time, helping us to release new controllers as frequently as possible. Every new Grid module will work flawlessly with modules released in the past.

Team

Music, electronics and arts have been our passion since high-school. Originally we wanted to create controllers for ourselves, but as our ideas matured, we decided to take it one step further. From late night jam sessions, to late night office hours. From DIY Synthesizers to twelve-hour drives to Berlin. Now here we are inviting you to be a part of this exciting journey!

We believe that Grid will be an ever growing project involving more and more creative people around the world.

column2:
Shipping

We estimate the shipping of the perks to start in April of 2019.

column1:
Grid controllers will be shipped with USB Type-C to USB-A 2.0 male cable.

Please make sure to choose World (Outside of the EU) perks if you are based in Norway, Switzerland, Russia, United States, Australia, Japan or elsewhere in the World. Shipping options are set up accordingly.

For our backers outside the EU import charges may apply based on local regulation. For backers in the EU, no additional import charges apply.

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

We have chosen crowdfunding to help us bring Grid to the world faster. Creating such product involves expensive manufacturing methods like injection molding. We have standing quotes for all of the components, our manufacturing partners are waiting for us to hit the 'Play' button.

The electronic component market is always full of surprises. Component shortages and increased lead times can delay the manufacturing process. Once the campaign is successfully funded, we will start tooling process. In order to ensure the availability of the parts needed, we already took steps to work with long-term logistics partners to ease worldwide material flow.

FAQ

Why is there no display?

column1: • ANA4 Module will feature a display allowing it to load different settings and presets to the other controllers.
• Depending on the demand we may release a dedicated transport control / clock source / midi hub module with a built-in display.
• No, but a USB Midi to DIN midi adapter can be used to solve that since the Grid is a Class Compliant USB HID Midi device.
• ANA4 Module will feature MIDI, CV, GATE and CLOCK through TRS jack connectors.

What's the latency? (Simple answer)

  • Can be as low as 5ms depending on the computer and operating system.

What's the latency? (More technical explanation)
• The perceived latency adds up from four main components. The DAW's audio processing engine, the audio drivers and settings, the operating system's USB stack and the USB Midi device itself.
• Using a studio microphone we measured the time difference from hitting a button on the controller to hearing the drum sound from the  speakers.
• Using an M-audio sound card in a Windows 7 workstation running Ableton Live 10, we measured 5ms latency. (Audio sample Rate: 44.1k, WDM Buffer: 64 samples)
<li>When you build a large control surface using the Grid, the module furthest away from one connected to USB will have the largest latency. Worst case added latency is currently &lt
column2: 1ms per module distance. (may improve with firmware upgrade)

column1:
Is there a brain module?

  • All of the modules feature a Type-C USB connector, any one of them can be used as the centerpiece of the control surface.

How many modules can be used at the same time?
• Up to 16 modules can be connected when using a 5V 3A capable USB port.
• The maximum brightness of the LEDs can be limited to allow even more controllers to be connected.
• Grid control modules can be connected in any orientation.
• Rotation of a module can even be mapped to different midi parameters.
Where can I find out more about the Grid?
• The latest news are available on intech.studio website
• Check out Youtube channel for more videos about the Grid
• Join the discussion in the dedicated Grid Controllers Facebook Group.
• Or contact us directly via email through support@intech.studio

Other Ways You Can Help

Please consider sharing this page with your friends, local producer, sound design or DJ groups. We want to reach all of the creative minds around the world!

If you have any questions about the Grid, or any ideas of what you would like to see in future modules then don't hesitate to contact us, we are always happy to chat!

To support us and become a backer click on the
column10:
>BACK ITbutton on the top of this campaign page or select a perk!

","The Grid

column1: After three years of continuous development, the Grid is finally ready for action. Throughout the years we developed a number of different prototypes, iterating on the design until we found the perfect solution. We believe that Grid brings a new perspective to creative controllers.

Grid features a unique X-Y mapping, with absolute and relative modes. Your control surface can be easily reconfigured at any time, even while playing live. Each position and even rotation of the modules can indicate a new mapping.

The control surface creates a seamless tactile user interface. The buttons and potentiometers are evenly spaced in a 1.05"" * 1.05"" (2.7 cm * 2.7 cm) array. This makes the Grid easy to play while also keeping it very portable.  We believe that Grid represents the perfect balance between modularity, usability and component density.
As your needs can change, Grid was designed to pick up your pace. You can easily down and upscale your control surface. Playing together with friends makes the Grid even more exciting.

All of the user interface components are carefully selected for superior electrical performance and mechanical reliability. We use the USB Type-C connector because it offers better power capability,  convenient reversibility and guaranteed 10,000 mating cycles.

Grid modules interconnect through a custom designed magnetic interface. The spring loaded connectors are designed for maximum reliability. The gold plating on the connectors allows them to be resistant to corrosion.

The new conductive plastic technology pontentiometers and linear faders in the PO16 and PBF4 modules are rated for 100,000 cycles, while the Omron buttons in the BO16 and PBF4 modules are rated for 3,000,000 cycles.

Grid modules offer unmatched control possibilities. We already implemented midi channel and control number settings, control change and note messages, 7-bit and 14-bit resolution (NRPN),  toggle, momentary and step modes.

Grid will also support user defined sysex packets allowing the Grid to control hardware synthesizers and other MIDI gear. The editor is currently in development and we would like to involve you in the final touches. Both the editor & Grid are cross-platform.

Grid by default sends MIDI over USB, it’s compatible with all MIDI capable application. Our mission is to create an extremely versatile and easy-to-use control surface at the same time. We already tested Grid with popular music software like Ableton, Bitwig, FL Studio and Traktor Pro. The array of available custom scripts for creative applications will only expand.
Grid can even be used with mobile devices and tablets using the correct USB OTG adapter.

Once you receive your Grid modules, we will provide templates and the control scripts for various software, quick start guide and manual. These will be available online as free download. We will publish an open hub once the modules are shipped. You will be able to share your own scripts, templates and stay up-to-date with our future software releases.

Take a sneak peak into the assembly model of the Grid module P016. It's modular both inside and outside. Re-using this design is straight forward, this is why we say Grid's sustainable modular variations are endless.

Grid modules are 4.2"" (10.7 cm) wide, allowing them to be mounted in a standard 3U Eurorack modular case. We are already working on ANA4 which allows the Grid modules to be directly connected to analog synthesizers and 5-pin DIN MIDI gear. Check out our video from SUPERBOOTH 18 for a sneak peek of what is to come!
Using a USB MIDI to 5-pin DIN MIDI adapter, Grid can control hardware synth or MIDI gear.
The following videos have been recorded during the pre-launch preparations,

In the first video Kristóf played an Ableton live set using three Grid controllers. As the live set evolves, so does the control surface. The PBF4  was used for main channel mixing, PO16 for controlling envelopes and effects and BO16 for launching midi clips and loops. If you are interested how we made the Ableton set, check out the walk-through video.

The second video is a snippet from a DJ set, using Native Instrument's Traktor Pro 2 and two Grid controllers. The PO16 module was used as a 4-band equalizer and effect control for two decks and PBF4 as one-knob filter, headphone and main out mixer. If you are interested how we made the Traktor mapping check out the walk-through video.
USB 2.0 compliant composite device (HID Midi, CDC Serial, DFU Bootloader)
Compatible with Windows, Mac and Linux (No drivers needed)
Support for major DAWs and music software
Tactile user interface featuring long life components
Compact size: 106mm x 106mm x 16mm (4.2” x 4.2” x 0.6”)

So you want to create your ideal MIDI controller, but don't want to go DIY and would rather have a system where each module fits together and looks really great? Say hello to GRID from Intech Studios."" - Ask Audio
The three starting modules are great choices. You can easily see how you would use them and arrange them for controlling all sorts of stuff."" - Gearnews
Not only are the Grid modules modular, but you can re-arrange them on the fly, and they’ll adapt automatically to their new context."" - Synthtopia
According to Intech, one of the ideas behind Grid is to blur the line between software and hardware control."" - AudioNewsRoom

The Grid already works. Now our number one priority is to start the tooling process as soon as possible. Once we are happy with the enclosure, we can focus on the PCB Assembly and testing. Finalizing the firmware and the software components is the last piece of the puzzle.

Launching the first three modules is just the beginning of the journey. We will use our tools and manufacturing chain to create new modules. Most of the firmware and the hardware designs can also be reused, further reducing the development time, helping us to release new controllers as frequently as possible. Every new Grid module will work flawlessly with modules released in the past.TeamMusic, electronics and arts have been our passion since high-school. Originally we wanted to create controllers for ourselves, but as our ideas matured, we decided to take it one step further. From late night jam sessions, to late night office hours. From DIY Synthesizers to twelve-hour drives to Berlin. Now here we are inviting you to be a part of this exciting journey!We believe that Grid will be an ever growing project involving more and more creative people around the world.
Perks & ShippingWe estimate the shipping of the perks to start in April of 2019.

Digital to Analog, Why It Matters

Digital to analog conversion is the process of turning binary 0 and 1 data into actual sound waves. If the conversion is not good, the use of even the best headphone or speaker won't help. Unfortunately, in your phone and computer, this is always the weakest link. ZuperDAC-S bypass this internal conversion and get back the awesomeness to you.

 

Bit Perfect, What You Listen is What Is Recorded

Due to the limitation of the DAC subsystem inside your phone and computer, original music recording may need to go thru sample rate conversion and introduces distortion. ZuperDAC-S support bit perfect audio up to 192kHz and requires no sampling rate conversion, thus delivering the authentic recording with no loss in translation. (Screen capture from USB Audio Player Pro app above with and without using ZuperDAC-S)

 

True Portable and Battery Free

Unlike other USB-DAC products which are bulky and need to recharge. ZuperDAC-S is so tiny and weighs less than 10g. You can carry and use it anytime without the worry to charge up first. Your phone and computer store all your music collections and connect you to other music sources. With the addition of the ZuperDAC-S, it readily turns your phone and computer into a HiFi music studio.

 

Simplicity is the Ultimate Sophistication

Using just simple line and curve combined into an amazing outline.  We used aluminum for the chassis material to give the best protection and texture.  There are 3 chassis color options, namely  silver, gray and red.  With the black color volume keys, it generates an overall 2 tone color scheme.

 

One ZuperDAC-S Fits All

ZuperDAC-S comes with 3 cables for USB-A, Micro-USB and USB-C interfaces. That means you can use the ZuperDAC-S in different platforms by just changing a cable. ZuperDAC-S support USB Audio Class 2 communication and is compatible with Windows, macOS, Linux, Android and iOS systems. For Windows users, please install our USB Audio Class 2 driver to take advantage of the capability beyond Windows provided (only support USB Audio Class 1).

 

So Easy, Just Plug and Play

Using ZuperDAC-S is easy. Pick the right cable for your interface choice (USB-A, micro-USB or USB-C), connect the micro-USB end to ZuperDAC-S and the other end to your phone or Apple Lightning to USB Camera adapter cable for the interconnection.computer. Plug in your earphone at ZuperDAC-S, that's it. For iPhone/iPad, you will need the Apple Lightning to USB Camera Adapter for the interconnection.

 

Astounding Sound Quality

ZuperDAC-S uses top of the line ESS Sabre 9018 DAC and amplifier. It is the preferred choice of many top tier brands and audiophiles. Paired with our USB Audio interface, it supports up to 192kHz sampling frequency and 24-bit bit depth (vs. standard CD recording at 44.1kHZ and 16-bit). With ZuperDAC-S, you can now enjoy high fidelity music with no road blocks.

 

Hardware Volume Control

Even with such a small form factor, we managed to include 2 buttons for volume control. Volume control at your phone and computer mostly adjust in the digital domain and reduces the audio dynamic range. By having volume control at the output end, we can eliminate this shortcoming. In addition, the last volume setting is stored inside ZuperDAC-S so it will come up with the right volume level on your next usage.

 

Reviews From Our Early Testers

""As the Italian music formation Mo-Do sang in German language in the 1990s, I conclude my review by saying that the ZuperDAC-S is “Super Gut” (“Super Good”)."", HiFiChris, see full review here.

""Enjoy ESS Sabre 9018Q2C balanced sound signature, clarity and transparent. Perfect for your mobile devices with slimmer design and hardware volume buttons."", Jayce Ooi, see full review here.

""ZuperDAC-S 就可讓你在毫不累贅的狀態下，獲得細節更為圓滑飽滿的聲音表現，再加上售價非常貼地，確實是一款物超所值的小配件。"", Eric Au Yeung - UNWIRE HK, see full review here.

""ZuperDAC-S 機身提供 16 段音量調校，輸出夠力外，機內的解碼晶片也能忠實還原音樂細節，人聲與樂器有明顯的分離，而且人聲暖和，使播放高清音樂檔時更有味道。"", Kan Heung - eZone HK, see full review here.

 

Bundled Cables

Micro-USB to Micro-USB (Left), Micro-USB to USB-C (Center), Micro-USB to USB-A (right). 12cm high quality cables with inside ground shielding and outer nylon fiber material that are both flexible and durable.

 

Stretch Goal

 

Technical Specification

 

Improvements from ZuperDAC

In the design of ZuperDAC-S, we have taken on the following improvements.

Perks Summary

 

Timeline

 

Shipping

All perks will be shipped using e-Express or registered air mail. Tax and duties are not included. Once we ship out your perk, we will notify you the tracking information through email. Please add support@zorloo.com to your contact list in order to avoid the notification email accidentally falls to your inbox spam.

 

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

We have gone through all product test and verification. All software and hardware are finalized. The overall design is very solid and confirmed by our early testers.

We have already arranged for pilot production and will have small quantity ready to ship right after the campaign. In the mean time, we are also working closely with the factory for the production arrangement in order to avoid any delay due to the Chinese New Year holidays shutdown. The risk should be minimum and we expect to ship on time.

column6: >We just made the Vero HCA29 even better!

column1: We heard you loud and clear! You asked for the Reference version of our Vero HCA29 and we delivered! This headphone amp blows our socks off!!
Read more about the new Reference Version in our current update!
The Vero Headphone Amp is for music lovers who are passionate about
the absolute best sound they can get out of their headphones.  <span style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
column4: >Through the use of
column13: >Technology and Silent Power
column19: >MIT Cables has developed Vero to present music they way it should be heard, as if it were truly being performed right in front of you.
column22: >Most users describe what they hear as ""holographic"" or spacious, meaning that they can literally point to the instruments and vocals as they are being presented, hearing notes and other nuances that didn't exist through their current listening source.
column28: >Vero Headphone Amp Features
column31: >

column1: What our Vero Beta Testers have to say

column2: >Anyone who has an appreciation for authentic and true sound in music. After all, Vero means ""True"" in Italian..
column3: >Music lovers will appreciate the simple, basic design that makes the Vero HCA 29 easy to use with any music source and headphone. Because it is battery powered, the Vero's portable deign provides an amazing listening experience anywhere you desire.
>Musicians, composers and sound and recording engineers
column5: > love Vero for its ability to attain each and every nuance of their recording. When writing music and scores, every note needs to be present, and with other devices, you won't achieve the best articulation points of sound frequencies without Multipole Technology, therefore, not allowing the ""true"" sound to come through. With Vero, and our patented Multipole Technology, every note, nuance, vocal, whisper, chord change, depth and texture of the music is present, all with a larger than life soundstage that allows the user to be present with the music as it is being played.

column1:
The Vero Headphone Amp works like any other, except for the fact that it is battery powered, and doesn't need an electrical supply in order for it to work. 
You can plug any music source that runs off of an 1/8"" input (like the cable from your phone, or any other MP3 or digital music player or source). You can also plug into the Vero HCA 29 through the RCA inputs on the back of the amp.

There are two outputs on the front panel, 1/4"" and XLR which are common inputs on most headphones. Once the Vero HCA 29 has a full charge, turn it on, plug your music source into the amp and your headphones into the front panel. You operate your music source as you would normally, except now the signal is running through the Vero HCA 29 and out to your headphones. 


Vero HCA 29 Product Specs

column4: >MIT Cables has been manufacturing high-end audio interfaces for more than three decades, bringing award winning products and solutions to home audio and professional recording studios around the world.
>Until now, Multipole™ Technology has only been housed within the little network “boxes” found on all of MIT Cables’ award-winning products, which have
column7: > been used on many Academy Award winning film scores and Grammy Award winning recordings.
column22: >For the first time ever, MIT is now putting this technology inside of a non-cable product, and the results are stunning!

column4: >The Vero HCA•29 Headphone Amp is the only headphone amp in the world housed with Multipole™ Technology. This new breakthrough product was
column7: >was designed with the help of Aaron Reiff, former Chief Engineer at Lucasfilm's Skywalker Sound and former audio engineer at Capital Studios, Hollywood.

column1:

This is due to the contrast of a background that is for the most part “silent”.

column1: MIT Cables will hand build the Vero HCA 29 Headphone Amplifiers with all assembly taking place in the MIT Factory in Rocklin, California. Each unit will be both electrically, as well as sonically approved before shipping, making sure that every Vero HCA 29 Headphone Amp is functioning perfectly providing the user with that legendary ""MIT Sound"".

During our last Indiegogo Campaign for the Vero Headphone Cable, we relied on the feedback from our backers to create our personal line of audio products, something we had never done before in our more than 30 years as an award winning audio interface manufacturer. Now, as we venture into a groundbreaking new product, the first of its kind, we need your input more than ever before to help us determine which version of the Vero HCA we bring to market.
Q: What is Multipole™ Technology and how is applied to the Vero HCA-29?

column7: >Multipole™ Technology works to overcome inefficiencies in audio interfacing. It works the same way on the active circuits from Aaron Reiff and Bruce Brisson. That is, it has MIT input circuit technology and output technology (just like our cables) for a total of 29 poles.  With this combination, the HCA-29 delivers a linear articulation response AND high current!

column1: Q: If I'm an early backer, will my perk be shipped first?

column1: We have been working on the design of the Vero HCA for over 6 months with our engineers and have done most of the hard work of developing the best headphone amp we are certain you have ever experienced, and do not foresee any complications to our product development that would delay your shipment within the time frame that we have established.

Of course, there is always a chance that our part suppliers have backorders or that Mother Nature decides to wreak havoc on any of our preparations, but we do not expect this or any other unforeseen acts of God or others to hinder our production schedule and anticipate shipping on time.
We will make sure to update our backers frequently on any progress or delays in production or shipping.
","We just made the Vero HCA29 even better!
We heard you loud and clear! You asked for the Reference version of our Vero HCA29 and we delivered! This headphone amp blows our socks off!!
Read more about the new Reference Version in our current update!
The Vero Headphone Amp is for music lovers who are passionate about

the absolute best sound they can get out of their headphones.  Through the use of  Multipole™ Technology and Silent Power™, MIT Cables has developed Vero to present music they way it should be heard, as if it were truly being performed right in front of you. Most users describe what they hear as ""holographic"" or spacious, meaning that they can literally point to the instruments and vocals as they are being presented, hearing notes and other nuances that didn't exist through their current listening source. Vero Headphone Amp Features
What our Vero Beta Testers have to say
Who needs the Vero Headphone Amp?

Anyone who has an appreciation for authentic and true sound in music. After all, Vero means ""True"" in Italian.. Music lovers will appreciate the simple, basic design that makes the Vero HCA 29 easy to use with any music source and headphone. Because it is battery powered, the Vero's portable deign provides an amazing listening experience anywhere you desire.

Musicians, composers and sound and recording engineers love Vero for its ability to attain each and every nuance of their recording. When writing music and scores, every note needs to be present, and with other devices, you won't achieve the best articulation points of sound frequencies without Multipole Technology, therefore, not allowing the ""true"" sound to come through. With Vero, and our patented Multipole Technology, every note, nuance, vocal, whisper, chord change, depth and texture of the music is present, all with a larger than life soundstage that allows the user to be present with the music as it is being played.

The Vero Headphone Amp works like any other, except for the fact that it is battery powered, and doesn't need an electrical supply in order for it to work. You can plug any music source that runs off of an 1/8"" input (like the cable from your phone, or any other MP3 or digital music player or source). You can also plug into the Vero HCA 29 through the RCA inputs on the back of the amp.

There are two outputs on the front panel, 1/4"" and XLR which are common inputs on most headphones. Once the Vero HCA 29 has a full charge, turn it on, plug your music source into the amp and your headphones into the front panel. You operate your music source as you would normally, except now the signal is running through the Vero HCA 29 and out to your headphones. Vero HCA 29 Product Specs

MIT Cables has been manufacturing high-end audio interfaces for more than three decades, bringing award winning products and solutions to home audio and professional recording studios around the world.

Until now, Multipole™ Technology has only been housed within the little network “boxes” found on all of MIT Cables’ award-winning products, which have been used on many Academy Award winning film scores and Grammy Award winning recordings. For the first time ever, MIT is now putting this technology inside of a non-cable product, and the results are stunning!

The Vero HCA•29 Headphone Amp is the only headphone amp in the world housed with Multipole™ Technology. This new breakthrough product was was designed with the help of Aaron Reiff, former Chief Engineer at Lucasfilm's Skywalker Sound and former audio engineer at Capital Studios, Hollywood.

Photo: Aaron Reiff and MIT Cable's Founder and President Bruce Brisson testing the latest Vero Prototype. What is MIT's Multipole™ Technology? How does it work with the Vero HCA 29?MIT Cables VP, Kent Loughlin explains  MIT Cables’ core audio technology is our
exclusive Poles of Articulation, named after
the fact that every audio signal has a single point where it is most
efficient at storing and transporting energy. At this point in the audio
frequency spectrum, the notes will articulate best, and represents the audio’s
particular Articulation Pole. The Vero HCA 29 Headphone Amp represents 29 Poles of Articulation, providing controlled bass, and smoother, more
extended highs along with a lower noise floor that is even more apparent with

Graph A: Represents the bandwidth of the audible range of the human ear. We will use this graph to describe how well a component articulates across the audible bandwidth. The 50% line serves as our baseline for articulation response.Graph B: This articulation plot describes an Articulation Pole tuned to a high frequency, described by audiophiles as “bright” or “fast.” Conversely, an Articulation Pole tuned to a lower frequency would be described by audiophiles as “muddy” or “veiled.” MIT Cables’ networks are engineered to have multiple Articulation Poles optimized for the lows, mids, and highs. Our Poles of Articulation synergistically work together to transport the audio signal with a more even, linear response. Graph C: This conceptual illustration shows how Multipole™ Technology works synergistically throughout the audio spectrum. Poles A & B provide an area of better bass, Poles C & D provide an area of better midrange, and Poles E & F provide an area of better highs. When you reduce noise, audio fidelity improves proportionally. Just like rolling the windows up in your car to listen to your car radio, there is no simpler way to improve audio fidelity. Similarly, if we decouple our audio electronics from AC power (60hz) and power them with DC (direct current) there is a plethora of low level detail to be retrieved. This is due to the contrast of a background that is for the most part “silent”.The Vero HCA•29 works on this principal, relying on two rechargeable lithium ion batteries to enable the “high end headphone enthusiast” to enjoy performance  similar to two channel systems found in the world’s finest audio salons. With the proper sources and a good set of modern headphones, listening to music through the Vero HCA•29 is commonly referred to as a “totally immersive” experience.Perks!
The Vero HCA 29 Order & Production/Fulfillment Timeline

MIT Cables will hand build the Vero HCA 29 Headphone Amplifiers with all assembly taking place in the MIT Factory in Rocklin, California. Each unit will be both electrically, as well as sonically approved before shipping, making sure that every Vero HCA 29 Headphone Amp is functioning perfectly providing the user with that legendary ""MIT Sound"".
Your Input is Valuable and Needed!

During our last Indiegogo Campaign for the Vero Headphone Cable, we relied on the feedback from our backers to create our personal line of audio products, something we had never done before in our more than 30 years as an award winning audio interface manufacturer. Now, as we venture into a groundbreaking new product, the first of its kind, we need your input more than ever before to help us determine which version of the Vero HCA we bring to market.
Q: What is Multipole™ Technology and how is applied to the Vero HCA-29?

A: Multipole™ Technology works to overcome inefficiencies in audio interfacing. It works the same way on the active circuits from Aaron Reiff and Bruce Brisson. That is, it has MIT input circuit technology and output technology (just like our cables) for a total of 29 poles.  With this combination, the HCA-29 delivers a linear articulation response AND high current!
Q: If I'm an early backer, will my perk be shipped first?

A: Vero Amp backers who opt in first will be shipped in the same order they backed the campaign. We will form a ""production queue"" as we get more backers. We project a production throughput of 5-9 units/wk so early backers will be rewarded.
Q: How long will it take before you begin shipping?

A: We believe that once the campaign has funded, it should take 30 to 45 days to receive the the parts for the campaign. However, delays in parts delivery may occur. We want to anticipate and minimize backorder issues with parts suppliers but this date cannot be guaranteed as exact. There is always a chance we may ship earlier, but we would rather side with caution. As we learned in the Vero Headphone campaign (we ran over by ~90 days) fulfilling orders are the top priority, but quality is number one. Ship dates are based on the order of backer funding, but factory throughput will be constant until all orders are filled.
Q: Does the HCA 29 include an impedance switch for IEM's?

A: We have decided not to include a circuit for IEM's. Why?We were tasked with ""making the MIT sound"" come from tiny IEM motors.  We tried a few ""familiar"" ways to address the IEM question but never reached a point where it met our standard. Perhaps it is due to differing quality In-Ear Monitors, but we just don't have the time to sort this out in 30 days, the span of the launch. After much discussion, we decided not to include it in this campaign. However, we reserve the right to offer this feature as an upgrade in the future. MIT products are legendary for providing a realistic listening experience, best described as holographic.
Q: How long does the Battery Charge last on the Vero HCA 29?
A: We are still finalizing the battery choice but early tests reveal a 2-3 hour charge will play about 16 hours.
Q: Can I use the Vero HCA 29 while it's charging?

A: Yes you can but the sound will include any line noise from your AC, including the power supply. Battery power (quiet power)  is a main feature of this design and critical listening should always be done with the charging circuit disconnected or unplugged. Besides a black background this feature also makes it ""transportable"" to any location in your home or on the road.  The footprint is only 8 1/2"" X 11"" X 3 1/2"" tall.

Q: If you already have the Vero Reference Headphone Cable in combination with the Bass Dongle and an additional adapter, will a future purchase of the Vero HCA 29 still have any added value on top of the network-cables, or is that rather too much of a good thing?

A: Technically, you can apply Multipole to each component to optimize the signal throughput. That said, when you couple the Dongle to another Dongle and then to a headphone cable, you CAN get too much of a good thing!

There are always risks involved with any crowdfunding campaign, and sometimes there are circumstances beyond our control that may delay the production of the Vero HCA 29. All of us here working on the Vero HCA Project are extremely confident in our ability to deliver MIT's first ever non-cable product in a timely manner!

This is our second crowdfunding campaign, and we are proud to say that we have completed our first project and have hundreds of happy backers who have provided us with exceptional feedback on our last campaign. So we have a bit of experience under our belt!

We have been working on the design of the Vero HCA for over 6 months with our engineers and have done most of the hard work of developing the best headphone amp we are certain you have ever experienced, and do not foresee any complications to our product development that would delay your shipment within the time frame that we have established.

Of course, there is always a chance that our part suppliers have backorders or that Mother Nature decides to wreak havoc on any of our preparations, but we do not expect this or any other unforeseen acts of God or others to hinder our production schedule and anticipate shipping on time.
We will make sure to update our backers frequently on any progress or delays in production or shipping.",17.0,1,"6 Campaigns
