Our Noodlebox Indiegogo Campaign has now finished. However the product will be on general sale in a few months. If you would be interested in updates please join our mailing list at
Noodlebox is a four part sequencer for making electronic music. It has analog CV/Gate outputs for each part and supports MIDI.
Fun and intuitive – Edit your synth lines in the bright clear graphical LED matrix - just like using an Etch-a-Sketch - and tweak them live while they play.

Great for jamming – Quickly loop and reverse sections of a sequence, jam with pitch transposition, crank crazy pitch randomness up and down then snap back to the original notes, incrementally add Euclidean gates... editing features common to many sequencers take on new creative and expressive meaning!

Quick for live arranging – Capture variations of a pattern into four different 'pages' and arrange them to cycle automatically in any order, all while still jamming live and without missing a beat. Quickly save compositions to memory and recall them later.

Powerful and flexible – Noodlebox is like having four step sequencers in one box, each with CV/Gate and MIDI output, and you can use it exactly like that. Or you can dive into the new possibilities opened up by the internal routing, cross-modulation and scaling of the four parts.
Solid construction – Comes as standard with lovely, solid oak end cheeks (from Synths And Wood) and powder-coated, extruded aluminium side rails. Reassuringly weighty!

No HP in the rack! – Why isn't Noodlebox a Eurorack module? Well, by staying on the desktop, it saves valuable space in your Eurorack setup, and you can move it around to where it's needed. Not to mention that a horizontal control surface is just so much more comfortable to use!

My name is Jason and I have been making electronic music accessories for almost 8 years. Over that time I've been able to leave the day job behind and focus on making open-sourced kits and products for musicians. These include the Arpie arpeggiator, Le Strum MIDI controller, Banana Split MIDI splitter, Orange Squeeze MIDI merge and the CV.OCD MIDI to CV converter. These products are all designed by me, assembled here in Brighton, UK with the occasional help of a couple of friends, and released under the Sixty Four Pixels brand name.
As a passionate musician myself, I have always wanted to make the type of
column3: >products that I would use.
column5: >The idea of Noodlebox came about from experience playing with simple knob-based step sequencers such as the Korg SQ-1, and in particular some experiments I did with linking multiple SQ-1s together in interesting ways (setting different sequence lengths/clock divisions, adding pitch CVs, multiplexing between CV outputs, swapping gates between sequencers and so on). What got me most excited were the quirky grooves and melodies that emerged
column6: unplanned but inspiring to build upon, tweak and refine.

column3: >Noodlebox is intended to bring that kind of fun experimentation and serendipitous workflow into a single compact device. With over a year of jamming with the prototype I have expanded the functionality into what I hope is a very immediate and hands-on live sequencer, perfectly paired with Eurorack and desktop analog synths in improvisational setups.

column1: Noodlebox has four independent sequencer layers, each with a CV/Gate output. Each layer runs separately to the others (although staying in sync) and has its own step count, clock division etc.

Each layer has four pages of up to 32 steps each. Pages can be used for A/B/C/D type pattern variations, for verse/chorus type song sections or chained to make a single pattern of up to 128 steps. You can cue up lists of pages for automatic cycling (up to 32 pages). Arranging pages is designed to be quick and easy to do creatively in a live setting.

Each step has a value range of 0-127 corresponding to row position of the data point in the scrolling window. This value corresponds to a chromatic or scale-forced note pitch CV (V/Oct or Hz/V output) or to a general purpose modulation CV (0 to 8V range). Freely mess with scaling modes during playback for microtonal weirdness!

User-entered CV points can be padded or interpolated into empty steps for fast creation of melodies and modulation slopes without the need to enter a value at every step. Voltage slew can be introduced between data points.

Gate points can easily be edited separately from CV points, so you can experiment with the rhythm of a fixed melody and vice-versa. The gate length (duty) is adjustable at layer level and any step can be “tied” to the next for legato play or rhythmic variation.

Gates can be set manually or by Euclidean algorithm. Each gate point can be assigned probability, retrigger/ratchet and accent (for MIDI velocity). Gate timing can be micro-offset for swing and slide effects, with or without randomness.

All layers can output MIDI notes or controller change (CC) messages, on shared or different MIDI channels. MIDI notes from an external keyboard can also be recorded and quantized into the grid while the sequence plays. Use Noodlebox as a MIDI looper just as intuitively as a guitar looper pedal.

Layers 2, 3, 4 can internally modulate the CV output of the previous layer by summing with it or overlaying it. This requires no special cable patching and can be used for automated transposition or adding simple variations to a sequence, right up to meandering microtonal craziness.

Editing features such as cloning and erasing data points, shifting patterns in pitch and timing, setting loop point and play direction, adding randomness (and taking it away again) are designed to be hands-on and creatively useful in a live setting.

Eight memory slots store the whole of the Noodlebox session (all four layers). An auto save memory slot is used when shutting down using the OFF button, so that you can pick up where you left off when you turn it on again. A special memory slot can also be prepared as a “template” for new sessions to save commonly used settings.
Input sockets: MIDI In (3.5mm TRS jack. MMA standard “type A”), Sync In (3.5mm mono jack. 5-15V pulses, selectable function), Aux In (3.5mm mono jack. 5-15V pulses, selectable function)

Output sockets: MIDI Out: (3.5mm TRS jack. MMA standard “type A”), Sync Out (3.5mm mono jack. 10V pulses, selectable function), Aux Out (3.5mm mono jack. 10V pulses, selectable function), 4 x Gate Out (3.5mm mono jack. 10V pulses), 4 x CV Out (3.5mm mono jack. 0-8V range, 12-bit resolution, V/Oct, Hz/V and selectable linear voltage scaling)
Display: custom LED assembly, 32 x 16 pixels (128 x 64mm), 3 brightness levels
Indicators: LEDs for tempo, MIDI activity, gate activity, power
Controls: 11  buttons, rotary encoder, power on and off switches
Processor: 32-bit ARM Cortex M0+ running at 48MHz, with 128k FLASH/16k SRAM. Firmware user-updateable by MIDI system exclusive (SYSEX) message
Power: 9-12V DC centre negative barrel, 2.1mm pin (guitar pedal type).
Enclosure: aluminium extrusion top/bottom, solid oak sides, 1.6mm composite PCB material front/back
Size: approx 185 x 155 x 24mm (40mm height including encoder knob)
Included accessories: 1 x wall-wart type power supply with mains pins for your region (UK, EU and US type supplies available), 2 x 3.5mm TRS to 5-pin MIDI breakout adaptors
We have been developing and refining Noodlebox for almost two years. When you support this campaign you are helping us to get over the last bump, which is the production run.

Noodlebox is our first crowdfunding campaign. We have decided to take this approach since the parts outlay for the production run is significantly higher than that of any previous product and we have found that we require additional funding for the PCB and surface mount fabrication.

At this time we have functional prototype units that are close to the final product. All product development to this point has been self-funded. While there are some final decisions to make around manufacturing, and some work to test the first release of the firmware, we're ready to begin production and present this campaign as a pre-order of a final product rather than the funding of product development.

All perk levels for this campaign include a full Noodlebox product set from the first batch of units. This includes a quality myVolts branded ""wall-wart"" power supply for your region (UK type, EU type or USA type) and a pair of MIDI breakout cables.
These will be shipped to you by an express courier service with tracking and a signature required (DHL or similar).

Depending on your perk level you may also receive a black, cotton Sixty Four Pixels logo T-shirt in your requested size and/or a set of Befaco Banananuts (coloured custom nuts for 3.5mm sockets, original knurled socket nuts will also be included).
All perk levels have the same price, which is lower than our anticipated retail price. Banananuts and T-shirts are limited quantity free gifts - so get in there early, folks :)
The Noodlebox hardware design is complete and we have ordered or received almost all of the components for the first production run
column2: custom aluminium extrusions and wooden end cheeks have already been sourced from small companies in the UK. Other electronic and electrical components have been sourced from well-known suppliers including Mouser, Farnell, RS and Rapid. So this will happen!!

column1: However, the challenge right now is to predict exactly how long it will take, given the current coronavirus situation. The main tasks left to complete, and things that may impact them, are

PCB manufacturing (making the blank circuit board panels). This will be done by a Chinese factory which is currently operating normally. However there remains a risk of unexpected delays impacting the manufacturing or shipping of the boards back to the UK.

PCB assembly (automated soldering of surface mount components to the circuit boards). Our Estonian contract manufacturer is currently open for orders although at a slightly reduced capacity. However there remains a risk of unexpected delays impacting the manufacturing or shipping of the boards back to the UK.

Product assembly (soldering additional components to the circuit boards, testing the finished boards, assembling boards into the enclosures, programming firmware, final testing, calibration and packing for dispatch). These steps are taken in our workshop in the UK. A long extension of current social distancing measures due to coronavirus may extend this process as I may not be able to employ the friends who would usually assist me with this work.

Finalise product firmware (testing, bug fixing, documentation). This work is being carried out in parallel with the above steps. I am doing this work myself, limiting possibility of unexpected delays (excepting illness etc).
The risks noted above are largely out of our control. However their impact will be to the timeline rather than whether production happens at all.

Our current anticipated timeline is that we'll have the assembled PCBs during May 2020 and be able to complete final product assembly during June. This timeline has us shipping units out during June or July 2020.
However we do ask you to be sure you accept that these timescales could be subject to change when you decide to support this campaign
Thank you very much for your interest and I hope you enjoy your Noodlebox!
Product video filmed and edited by Darren Stockford.

Please note that photos and video are of the final prototype. The production version is expected to be identical, although we might make some small changes (for example to the switch caps and the knob). Any display flickering visible on the video is an artifact of the camera and not visible during use.

column2: >2x 4200mAH Big Battery, More Than Most Speaker
>Normal use for 8 hours, Half volume Sound can be used for 16 hours, Charging for 3 hours
>Convenient and fast, it can be used as a mobile power source to charge your mobile phone at any time.
>3-4Hours Speaker is full of electrical time

>D20 custom developed dual wireless Bluetooth 4.2 chip solution, double-click wireless connection to become independent Left and right channel speakers can also be connected to different devices by splitting.Become two independent Bluetooth speaker consoles.

>Powered by the latest wireless technology, D20 is easy to adjust for an optimal audio 
experience and ultimate convenience. Spatially separated left and right channels boost 
the delivery of real stereo effects. The built-in subwoofer in each speaker enhances bass 
and creates crisp, high-definition music wherever you go.
>D20 speakers can be easily attached to a backpack, attached with a carabiner (included in package), or carried by hand.
>Having an IPX5 rating means D20 meets a stringent standard of water resistant performance after multiple rounds of rigorous lab testing.
>Bose tuner from the beginning of the design to participate in the whole sound quality adjustment and control, sound quality low frequency be sink, IF be more stable, high frequency be wider.

column1: Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:
• Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
• Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.
Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?
Break it down for folks in more detail:
• Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
• Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
• Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

The revolutionary EchoWeek by REECHO team is a perfect set of compact true wireless earbuds deliver flawless audio without skimping on style. Taking many of elements that have served other elite wireless earphones well, REECHO-EchoWeek can handle rigorous workouts while also tracking activity and playing music. Moreover, 7 vibrant colors, 48 hours of battery life, Bluetooth 5.0 and waterproof IPX6 make it a great choice in the burgeoning new “ hearables” marketplace.

Balanced armature (BA) drivers are smaller than dynamic drivers, and because of their size, they are only available in in-ear monitor (IEM).
They are known to be more expensive than dynamic driver counterparts.
The driver consists of a miniature arm (armature) inside a coil of wire surrounded by two magnets. The top and bottom magnets determine the movement of the armature. When there is no net force on the armature, it means that it is at equal distance from both magnets, we say that it is “balanced”.
REECHO-EchoWeek team innovatively adopted the world's smallest rounded balanced armature unit as the driver of earbuds, so there are some significant advantages: 1. Premium sound and superior sound-isolating effect. 2. Requires less power than a normal dynamic driver. 3. Small and lightweight (the balanced armature of REECHO-EchoWeek is only 0.16g, and single-sided earbuds is only 4.2g)

 

Bluetooth 5.0 is the latest version of the Bluetooth wireless communication standard which means our EchoWeek can maintain a super stable wireless connection within 10m range and use with lower power consumption and higher speed. Combining a streamlined, ultra-comfortable fit with premium sound, EchoWeek earphones feature a lightweight design and enhanced Bluetooth performance not only for everyday use but passionate sports enthusiasts in pursuit of their limits.

 

 

Ordinary true wireless earphones are often too big to fit comfortably into your ear, even they fall off when you are exercising. In addition, when it comes to in-ear noise-isolating earphones, getting a tight seal is crucial to optimizing sound quality and bass performance. We managed to let different users get a perfect fit in different situations with 3 size of wingtips and eartips. You’re even able to run with them without a problem and they're water-resistant with an IPX6 waterproof rating. 

 

As active, digital natives, we understand that there is a long way to go in the field of recharging. EchoWeek were designed with unrivaled battery life. They offer solid wireless performance, 6 hours of battery life better than AirPods(4.5 hours) and a compact charging case(it isn't as small as the AirPods case, but it's still pretty small) for an extra 8 charges. It will help you with any workout and provide you with entertainment during your trip.

This brandnew wireless earbuds, EchoWeek, is available in seven trendsetting colors including Black, White, Blue, Orange, Red, Space Grey and Pink to name several. There are plenty of choices to meet your daily mood for the week.

Smart Assistant

REECHO-EchoWeek is compatible with Siri/Google Assistant/and Smart speakers. Simply press the button 3 times to activate your favorite personal assistant without having to remove the earbuds or touch your phone. 

Sweatproof

REECHO-EchoWeek upgraded to the latest IPX6 sweatproof rating, prevent the earphones damaged from ordinary splashing water and rain. Keep the earphones working well no matter you’re getting drenched in sweat after a grueling workout.

Right now, most wireless earphones only offer limited control, such as play/pause or waking up a virtual assistant. 
EchoWeek will provide you with a higher level of control over your phone than ever before. Use our more humanized Advanced Control to stay off your device and free your hands. 

Share Mode &
column2:
Single Mode

Share Mode: With this TWS earbuds you can share music or video with your friend, lover, family. You all will enjoy the high-quality stereo sound listening time.
Single Mode: Each of the Bluetooth earbuds can be used for single channel mode, ideal for driving or avoiding missing the sound around you.

Help Us to Unlock Our Stretch Goals!

Below are our elaborate stretch goals, and let’s work together to achieve more brilliant goals. When we achieved those goals, every backer will get extra gifts.

Why do we release the referral program? To celebrate crowdfunding launch and thanks for everyone’s support, we decide to release this referral program. In order to motivate you to share, we provide these very great free rewards. It’s super easy to share with your friends, family, colleagues, and neighbors. Join us to win the FREE prize!

 

Our referral program started from Mar 6th, 2019 to Mar 16th, 2019.

If your shares refer a backer to our campaign, and they pledge more than one REECHO EchoWeek, you will win FREE rewards!

The more you share, the more you will win!

*NOTE: Referral program is only for REECHO backers! And all refers will be tracked by Indiegogo.
column3:
linkname=EchoWeek%2C%20The%20Smallest%20Rounded%20BA%20TWS%20Earbuds%20%7C%20Indiegogo"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">

We've spent several months developing a ready-to-use model and guarantee delivery. Purchase a product today, you do not have to wait a long time to get your own EchoWeek.

column1: Q: Why won’t my Bluetooth device connect to my EyE?
A: If your Bluetooth device won’t connect to your EyE, try the following:
• Make sure EyE is standing and turned on
• Make sure your phone is connected to EyE and Bluetooth is activated.
• Place your phone/tablet closer to the EyE, it might be out of range
• Close the stand to turn EyE off, and then switch back on, to reset the EyE
• Delete/forget all EyE IDs on your phone to re-pair again
• If you have more than 2 speakers, make sure you are connected to the correct one.

Q: When will my order arrive?
A:  It's in production now.  We'll keep you updated on the shipping information. We will make sure your orders deliver to you as soon as possible.
Q: Where do you ship to?
A:     We ship worldwide. Wherever you are, we ship it to you.
A:     It is free delivery for the US and Taiwan. For other locations flat US$25 for a pair of EyE (2x EyE).
A:  For each EyE box: EyE speaker, USB Charging cables,  Remotes, Velvet        Pouches, Instruction manual. For EyE Pair, it comes with two boxes.
Q: What is the size of EyE?A:   Diameter: 6"" (154mm), Thickness: 2.3"" (59mm), Height: 3.7"" (95mm),                    Weight: 14 oz. (402g).
A:   No, it is not waterproof.
Q: Can EyE be turned on without opening the handle?
A:  No, EyE can not be turned on without opening the handle (kick stand).
Q: How many colors does EyE come with?
A:  EyE comes with two different skin choices, translucent Black and clear White. No matter which skin, EyE can generate 16,000,000 colors through LED lighting.
Q: How long does the battery last?

A:  Single EyE has 2600mAH, and a Pair has total of 5200 mAh Li-ion built-in battery.  Playing music  with  higher volume (13/16 scale) & sync lighting, it can last  more than  10 hours. If light is off, it can even last more than 20 hours.
Q: Why is EyE bass better than others?

A:  Some conventional speakers use passive resonant plates that create loud     but  fake bass. EyE adopts ""Swiss Horn"" resonant tube concept to produce the most natural  and  powerful bass. Based on the design, it generates fidelity sound quality.  Recently, 90% visitors to Yantouch SXSW booth agree EyE sound better than Bose Mini. Q: How far can my phone pair to Eye?

A:    Eye uses Bluetooth 4.1, A2DP, SPP, TWS (True Wireless Stereo). The           Bluetooth  range from your phone/Apple TV to the Left speaker is more  than 40m (130feet) , Left to Right speaker is also 40m.
Q: What does the warranty cover and how long is it?

A: 1.    One year from the date of manufacturer produce. If a defect exists, at its option  Yantouch will repair the product at no charge. Though, users are responsible  for the shipping cost.    2.   Any breakdowns or not function properly caused by anthropic factors, costs  will be collected from the users.
Q: How can I have the true wireless stereo? How long is the setup process?

A:     First, you need to place two EyEs to the left and right, and just simply open the  stands of both EyEs. The left & right speakers will automatically link together  with a beep, and then connect your phone to the left (master) channel. The  whole setup process will only take you a minute.
Q: When I place two EyEs to the left and right, how much time does it takes for stereo pairing?
A:    It only takes 30 second for both left and right Eyes to be paired.
Q: After stereo pairing, how far can Left (Master) and Right(Slave) being separated?

A:   Working distance depends on  density of obstructions and other wireless       interferences. Although actual working distances may be much bigger,                 suggested distance from Phone to Left is 10 m, from Left to Right is also             10 m. Both speakers share the same Bluetooth connection and play same music while  being located into two different places.
Q: Why won’t my Bluetooth device connect to my EyE?
A: If your Bluetooth device won’t connect to your EyE, try the following:
Make sure EyE is standing and turned on
Make sure your phone is connected to EyE and Bluetooth is activated.
Place your phone/tablet closer to the EyE, it might be out of range
Close the stand to turn EyE off, and then switch back on, to reset the EyE
Delete/forget all EyE IDs on your phone to re-pair again
If you have more than 2 speakers, make sure you are connected to the correct one.
Q: Do I have to pay for the app HueDJ?
A:     No, the app is free to download.
Q: Where can I download HueDJ App? Is HueDJ compatible with my device?
A:     You can find ""HueDJ"" App from the App Store on your ""iOS"" device or the   Google  Play Store on your ""Android"" device. Just search ""Yantouch HueDJ"".
Q: What can I do with HueDJ?
A:     With the app, you can access to these awesome features:
Q: How to connect to Hue? How can I pair multiple EyE speakers to Hue?
A:   HueDJ can let you pair up to 4 EyEs. However, when you pair four EyEs at the  same time, only one pair of EyEs play music. The other pair of EyEs can only  control the lights .
Q: Where can I find the virtual remote?
A:    You will find the virtual remote on the top-right corner. It replicates the actual   remote so it looks and works similar to the physical remote.
Q: Where can I set my reading mode?
A:    You can select the reading mode in “Sleep"">>""Setup"">>""Reading"".
Q: What If my EyE battery is running out, will my alarm still play?
A:   The alarm sound will still play from your tablet or cell phone, but no alarm light on EyE.
Q: What if my phone battery is running out, will the alarm still play on my EyE?
A:   The alarm light will still go off from your EyE, but no alarm sound.
Q: Can I set my alarm to repeat?
A:    You can set your alarm to repeat daily by selecting “Daily Wake” in the app   Alarm settings.
Q: How to setup your favorite music/song as your alarm?
A:    You can set your favorite music/song by selecting “Wake/Sleep Play List”, and you can choose any songs/music in your phone to be your alarm.",24.0,1,"2 Campaigns

The best moments in life are made for sharing, that's why we created STREAMR, a unique social audio device that lets you stream your audio with an unlimited number of people around you via the latest Bluetooth technology.   

STREAMR is made for sharing, that's why we've designed four stunning colors so you can tell which one is yours and match it to your personal style. 

 

STREAMR works super simple (although it took a lot of effort to get us there). You simply connect the first STREAMR to your phone/laptop/tablet with Bluetooth like you would any other headset. And then the magic happens! The first STREAMR turns into, well, a streamer! And other STREAMRS around it pick up on the signal with the exact same audio without any delay.

You're now ready to enjoy your favorite audio with your favorite people. Share a movie on a plane, start an impromptu silent disco in the subway with your friends or huddle around a Zoom call with crystal clear sound.  

STREAMR works with any regular set of headphones if you've already got your favorites that you're not ready to part ways with. STREAMR's high-end Bluetooth chips and microphone give you crystal clear wireless audio, giving you perfect conference call audio on headphones that originally didn't even have a mic.

We're also including a single earbud that's purposefully designed for STREAMR when you need to quickly answer a call or store it with one hand. Using a powerful, tiny magnet it clips onto your STREAMR so you always have your audio within reach. 

The magnetic earbud fits snug in your ear and the cable is optimized for a shorter length, making it a great tangle-free option to use during workouts.

 

 

If you want to pick up a phonecall hands-free, just give STREAMR a tap anywhere on the device, it's super simple.
column3:
>  

We've searched high and low for the very best components because we want you to enjoy your STREAMR for years to come. We see our fair share of shoddily engineered Bluetooth ? and we don't want that.

 

That's why we're using Qualcomm's aptX chipset, combined with an amp from Texas Instruments, it ain't cheap but it sounds great. A built-in rechargeable battery lets you use STREAMR for up to 10 hours at normal volume.

Even though STREAMR comes in a tiny housing, it packs a punch.

 

If you need low latency to blast through walls without delay in your sound, we've got a Pro-gamer edition for you! 

It's the same awesome STREAMR, but we've upgraded the Bluetooth chip to aptX-LL instead of aptX-HD.  The combination of low latency and endless multi-user audio is a first in gaming and it allows you to have gaming parties with a large group of friends, even when you're socially distancing. (It's depressing that we have to mention this, but yeah, keep that distance!)

We've designed four beautiful colors, from deep black to rose gold for you to choose from. To keep things simple, you don't choose your color when you checkout on Kickstarter, but when we send you an email to ask for your address, you'll also be able to specify the colors you want to receive. Feel free to mix &
column4: match if you order a bunch, we know life isn't just black and white. The black &amp
column5: white colors are available on all reward tiers, the rose gold and forest green are available Family pack &amp
column6:
up.

 

All rewards come with our signature single-piece earbud with built-in magnets to make it snap back on STREAMR and accessories like charging cables and a manual.

Since we've already successfully funded on Kickstarter before going to Indiegogo, we're looking to start manufacturing in August and start shipping out the first rewards in September!

Hi! We're Adon and Joris, Adon is a manufacturing veteran and Joris used to work at Kickstarter. In 2017  Jackster, a product from Adon's factory was launched on Kickstarter, which was a new way to make wired headsets wireless (it was very cool in 2017, ok!?).

We met at Trouble Maker, our favorite maker space at the heart of Shenzhen's electronics district. Where we started playing around with the old Jackster units and came up with the idea to use the molds for the enclosures with new circuit boards to make a completely new thing. Making the molds for the plastics is the most expensive part of any hardware product, so we figured if we could re-use those, we wouldn't have to raise a fortune to make something awesome and new, and so STREAMR was born.

The Printed Circuit Boards (PCB) of STREAMR and Jackster

","The best moments in life are made for sharing, that's why we created STREAMR, a unique social audio device that lets you stream your audio with an unlimited number of people around you via the latest Bluetooth technology.   STREAMR is made for sharing, that's why we've designed four stunning colors so you can tell which one is yours and match it to your personal style.  STREAMR works super simple (although it took a lot of effort to get us there). You simply connect the first STREAMR to your phone/laptop/tablet with Bluetooth like you would any other headset. And then the magic happens! The first STREAMR turns into, well, a streamer! And other STREAMRS around it pick up on the signal with the exact same audio without any delay.You're now ready to enjoy your favorite audio with your favorite people. Share a movie on a plane, start an impromptu silent disco in the subway with your friends or huddle around a Zoom call with crystal clear sound.  STREAMR works with any regular set of headphones if you've already got your favorites that you're not ready to part ways with. STREAMR's high-end Bluetooth chips and microphone give you crystal clear wireless audio, giving you perfect conference call audio on headphones that originally didn't even have a mic.We're also including a single earbud that's purposefully designed for STREAMR when you need to quickly answer a call or store it with one hand. Using a powerful, tiny magnet it clips onto your STREAMR so you always have your audio within reach. The magnetic earbud fits snug in your ear and the cable is optimized for a shorter length, making it a great tangle-free option to use during workouts.  If you want to pick up a phonecall hands-free, just give STREAMR a tap anywhere on the device, it's super simple.    We've searched high and low for the very best components because we want you to enjoy your STREAMR for years to come. We see our fair share of shoddily engineered Bluetooth ? and we don't want that. That's why we're using Qualcomm's aptX chipset, combined with an amp from Texas Instruments, it ain't cheap but it sounds great. A built-in rechargeable battery lets you use STREAMR for up to 10 hours at normal volume.Even though STREAMR comes in a tiny housing, it packs a punch. If you need low latency to blast through walls without delay in your sound, we've got a Pro-gamer edition for you! It's the same awesome STREAMR, but we've upgraded the Bluetooth chip to aptX-LL instead of aptX-HD.  The combination of low latency and endless multi-user audio is a first in gaming and it allows you to have gaming parties with a large group of friends, even when you're socially distancing. (It's depressing that we have to mention this, but yeah, keep that distance!)We've designed four beautiful colors, from deep black to rose gold for you to choose from. To keep things simple, you don't choose your color when you checkout on Kickstarter, but when we send you an email to ask for your address, you'll also be able to specify the colors you want to receive. Feel free to mix & match if you order a bunch, we know life isn't just black and white. The black & white colors are available on all reward tiers, the rose gold and forest green are available Family pack & up. All rewards come with our signature single-piece earbud with built-in magnets to make it snap back on STREAMR and accessories like charging cables and a manual.Since we've already successfully funded on Kickstarter before going to Indiegogo, we're looking to start manufacturing in August and start shipping out the first rewards in September!Hi! We're Adon and Joris, Adon is a manufacturing veteran and Joris used to work at Kickstarter. In 2017  Jackster, a product from Adon's factory was launched on Kickstarter, which was a new way to make wired headsets wireless (it was very cool in 2017, ok!?).We met at Trouble Maker, our favorite maker space at the heart of Shenzhen's electronics district. Where we started playing around with the old Jackster units and came up with the idea to use the molds for the enclosures with new circuit boards to make a completely new thing. Making the molds for the plastics is the most expensive part of any hardware product, so we figured if we could re-use those, we wouldn't have to raise a fortune to make something awesome and new, and so STREAMR was born.The Printed Circuit Boards (PCB) of STREAMR and Jackster",19.0,0,"3 Campaigns

column1: In rural Kenya, many workers at local health clinics are afraid to go home at night.  They fear not for their safety, but for the safety of their vaccines.

The problem is that electricity in these areas is often unreliable, and clinics lose power on a routine basis.  Once the power goes out, clinic refrigerators stop working and refrigerated vaccines and other medications start to go bad. Such breakdowns often happen at night or over the weekend without warning, leaving the vaccines inside to spoil and become ineffective.  Sometimes fridges malfunction and freeze the vaccines, destroying them.
Some clinics have gas-powered fridges or back-up generators, but fridges have to be manually switched over, and even these devices can develop mechanical failures or simply run out of gas.

As a result, clinic workers feel they have to keep constant watch over their medications.  For them, it is worth it because vaccines are one of the most effective medical interventions created, saving millions of children each year.  They dramatically reduce childhood mortality and increase the quality of life for children and their families.

Clinics want to make sure there are sufficient vaccines to treat their patients.  In fact, every year 25 million children – that’s 1 in 5 children born – do not receive these life-saving vaccinations. Often because the vaccines spoil or are wasted.
One low-cost and direct way of preventing vaccine waste is to give clinic workers in developing countries tools to ensure that vaccines are maintained at proper temperatures.

We are working with Medic Mobile and Direct Relief to build invaluable collaborations with in-country Ministries of Health, and distribute ColdTrace devices to clinics in Kenya and Haiti. We are also working with University of Washington to pilot Bluetooth devices to extend the reach of cold chain coverage.

ColdTrace is a new, low-cost temperature sensor that wirelessly connects with other ColdTrace units to create a global sensor network designed to keep vaccines safe on their journey to rural clinics in developing countries.

ColdTrace uses a cellphone to keep track of the temperature inside refrigerators where vaccines are stored and sends a text message alert to clinic managers when the temperatures are reaching dangerous limits.
The alert gives the managers a chance to either fix the refrigerator or move the vaccines to a safer location.

ColdTrace data is transmitted by every device in the network to a global database that helps health agencies, hospitals and clinics understand the weaknesses in their vaccine distribution systems and make better decisions that ensure life-saving treatments reach everyone.

After only one month using ColdTrace, all 8 clinics in Kenya that tested the device have said they would like to start paying for units.  This sentiment was echoed by the District Minister of Health, who has said he can partially fund a scale up of this device to every clinic in his area.  We would like to help him achieve this goal.
Millions of doses of vaccines are donated to developing countries annually by pharmaceutical companies, philanthropic aid organizations, and donor nations.

Many of them never reach the children that need them most. In too many instances, vaccines have to be discarded because they are not stored at the correct temperature.  A little too hot, or a little too cold, and the vaccine has to be thrown away.
Over 2.4 million children die each year as a result of vaccine-preventable diseases.
We believe that ColdTrace can be part of a solution to this problem by providing an affordable and easy-to-use way of ensuring that vaccines are kept at safe temperatures.
There are two main problems in current vaccine distribution systems in developing countries.

column2: >Unreliable Infrastructure:  In most developing countries, the infrastructure used to transport and store vaccines is old, electricity is unreliable, and backup power can be erratic.

column1: Fridge failures are common, they are loosely monitored, and they often go unreported.

column2: >It’s Difficult to Identify Failures:  Without monitoring, weaknesses in the distribution system are difficult to identify and fix in a systematic way.

column1: As a result, vaccine wastage remains a persistent, unresolved problem.
Currently, monitoring of vaccines relies on clinic workers looking at basic thermometer readings and recording them with pen and paper.
Because it is so labor intensive, this monitoring only happens at one point in the distribution chain, if at all.  This leaves many other points of potential failure without monitoring.

Also, pen and paper systems are prone to human error, and because they are not kept in electronic form, they are not easy to share with administrators or health agencies that could provide better management and oversight.
There are commercial temperature monitors available.  But they are either too expensive for widespread use in developing nations or they lack useful features such as wireless upload of data.
WHY IS COLDTRACE BETTER THAN THE ALTERNATIVES?

The ColdTrace project aims to construct a temperature sensor that costs less than $50 and that can provide real-time information on every step of the distribution chain, which can dramatically boost the effectiveness of vaccine distribution around the world.
• SMS alerts about vaccines reaching critical temperatures.
• Correlation of temperature data and the location of the phone.
• A globally available database of temperature data.

ColdTrace uses existing cellphone technologies in a new way to dramatically reduce the cost of wireless sensor data collection.  Unlike similar approaches, which employ microcontrollers or other costly components, ColdTrace takes advantage of the sophisticated electronics, battery and other features that already exist on the cellphone.
By building upon this standard technology, we can dramatically reduce the overall cost of the sensors and make it possible for almost any basic phone to serve as a wireless sensor.
This allows ColdTrace to bring remote monitoring to developing areas that have extremely low resources.
We have deployed ColdTrace prototypes in 8 clinics around Kilifi, Kenya, and in 8 facilities in Haiti.  These clinics serve the rural poor and often face extreme shortages of vital resources.
WHAT HAS COLDTRACE ACCOMPLISHED SO FAR?
ColdTrace has already saved thousands of vaccines in Kenya during an early field test.

This occurred during a weekend when no clinic workers were present to check on the cold storage unit.  Upon receiving a ColdTrace alert about rising refrigerator temperatures, the clinic manager immediately came in and was able to fix the problem.  An alert received the very next day led to a more extensive analysis of the refrigerator and the discovery of a much larger problem.  The clinic manager credited ColdTrace with saving the entire lot of vaccines stored in her fridge.
As a result of this success, the clinics and the District Ministry of Health in Kilifi have committed funds and resources to continue using and scaling up ColdTrace.
WHAT IMPACT WILL MY CONTRIBUTION HAVE?
Our goal is to build ColdTrace into a system that is an integral part of delivering life-saving vaccines to the 25 million children who do not receive them each year.

Your contribution will directly support up to 50 clinics in Kenya, and another 10 clinics in Ethiopia that want to receive the ColdTrace device.  These clinics will begin contributing data to the ColdTrace global database, and they will help us continue testing and refining the ColdTrace device for large-scale distribution.
• Adapting our existing prototype device to be able to run on Kenyan cellphones that cost as little as $25 and to reduce its size and increase its portability.
• Deploying 50 ColdTrace units in Kenyan clinics, in cooperation with the District Ministry of Health, for testing and troubleshooting.

Your contribution will help make ColdTrace an important part of an integrated, broadly available, data-driven process for managing vaccine distribution in low-resource areas.  As a result, your contribution will help us move toward providing more vaccines and safer medical treatments to millions of children around the world.

We are so grateful for the opportunity to be working with local clinics, District Ministries of Health, NGOs, and organizations like the Pan American Health Organization (a regional office of the World Health Organization).  Your contribution will help move this project forward and will directly impact the health of many people on the ground.
Nithya Ramanathan, President of Nexleaf Analytics
Martin Lukac, Chief Technology Officer of Nexleaf Analytics
For the last 10 years, we have been using cellphones to build wireless sensors that address difficult public health and environmental problems.
We love taking low-cost technologies and adapting them to provide robust, affordable solutions to pressing real-world dilemmas.

We have developed technologies to better understand arsenic in the groundwater in Bangladesh, to monitor endangered sea birds in the Pacific Ocean, to measure earthquakes in California, and to mitigate climate change through the introduction of clean cookstoves in India.
Just as cellphones have changed the lives of billions of people around the world, we think that cellphones can change the way we confront global health and environmental challenges.
We are excited to have you help us create that change!

Nithya also currently serves as an Assistant Research Professor at UCLA, where she was awarded one of the highly competitive $1M Challenge Grants from the National Institutes of Health to develop mobile platforms to improve the cardiovascular health of women.  She received her Ph.D. in Computer Science from UCLA and holds a B.S. degree from University of California at Berkeley in Electrical Engineering.  She is a PopTech Fellow, a Rainer Arnhold Fellow and a Switzer Environmental Fellow.  Nithya lives in Los Angeles with her husband and two energetic children.

Martin holds a B.S. from Haverford College, and he received his Ph.D. from UCLA for innovations in wireless seismic and acoustic sensing systems.  His research experience includes building, deploying, maintaining, and evaluating embedded systems for seismic, structural, environmental, and public-health applications.  Martin spends his free time modding his household appliances and trying not to crash his quadcopter.

We have had the privilege of working with the teriffic teams from Medic Mobile in Kenya and Direct Relief in Haiti.  Both organizations have been key collaborators in the ColdTrace project and will continue to work with Nexleaf as we scale up the production and distribution of devices.

Our vision is to offer premium quality bluetooth earbuds while minimizing markups and passing those savings on to our customers.

$160 for bluetooth headphones (on top of a new $900 phone without a headphone jack) is too much. The top brands on the market today are expensive
column2:
a low-end price of $95 to a high-end price of $200+. We can offer the same premium sound quality, durability and performance but at a price that everyone can afford.

          

After some serious number crunching and creative material allocations, we were able to mass-assemble custom component wireless earbuds at price point that allows us to not only beat competitor prices on similar products, but also support company growth.

 

 

To elaborate on what is meant by ‘creative material allocations’, in our early development stages we sent out several ROI’s to obtain manufacturing possibilities of Renobudz. Upon extensive communication with multiple factories, we were able to articulate and illustrate our final product objective to result in several orders of various prototype/sample components that would be cross-compatible, to function as wireless bluetooth stereo earbuds at a low cost. For example, there are hundreds of different bluetooth chip modules that will all function exactly the same, but they have a few key differences - that factory they were produced at and the raw materials used. All of these factors result in several factories in several countries that produce similar functioning components with different MOQ (minimum order quantity) and FOB (Freight On Board/Cost Per Unit). After realizing how overseas manufacturing factories operate, receiving multiple shipments of various Bluetooth audio chip modules (RN4020/BM77/AB1511), earbud casings made from PVC/PET/PS Injected Molds, end earpieces in different sizes made from different types of rubber (NBR/HNBR/EPDM), we were then able to communicate with the various factories about purchasing mass quantities of single components (chip/casing/earpiece/dock/cable/packaging). After gathering the required info on the individual parts for a full functioning pair of wireless bluetooth earbuds, we coordinated shipments from multiple factories to all be delivered to the assembly factory. By do all of this, we were able to create a very competitive product that is priced as close to cost as possible while still allowing for Renovo Tech to operate.

 

With honest pricing, we are able to attract a larger, more loyal customer base, which will help increase the growth of our company. As the company continues to grow, manufacturing costs will decrease, allowing us to stay in the business of offering honest pricing on premium quality earbuds. After several months of working with various manufacturers, we have built a relationship with a reliable factory and conducted sample quality checks from multiple orders to ensure a lasting product.
column4:
showinfo=0"">
 

       

 

 

The key to realizing our vision is securing sufficient funding to maximize manufacturing price cuts. We will do this by finalizing pre-determined purchase orders with our manufacturer which will allow three things to happen: regular income for our manufacturer, the lowest possible manufacturing cost for us, and the lowest consumer price for the ultimate win/win/win. With your support you will get the best possible deal on our product.

Renovo Tech - Outsourcing the best individual raw materials from numerous factories and/or countries, resulting in the best combination of components to make up an amazing final deliverable.

Risks and challenges

Risks for this project are minimal. We have a product that provides a quality listening experience. The risk is that there are a few similar products on the market as the market is beginning to be saturated with the development of this technology. This being said, none of the other options come close to our price with the MSRP of the least expensive products doubling ours.

showinfo=0"">

 A. Previous products used hard cases. This allowed sound to be reflected and easily heard. In ZEROi’s case, we use a soft cloth material that absorbs leaking sound.

B. Space was limited with other products. A buffer is needed around the bone conduction speaker to prevent any leakage of vibrations. Other products had a difficult time adding this aspect because the case was too small. ZEROi has enough room where the buffer is needed which absorbs the sound.

column4:
>

ZEROi is a hat with four built-in bone conduction speakers. With this technology, you can listen to music or make phone calls, without earphones, while being aware of your surroundings. ZEROi is water resistant, easy to use, and convenient on the go.

column6:
>

 Bone conduction is a way of transmission of sound. Sound waves are transmitted at a frequency that can be conducted through the bones of the skull. ZEROi doesn’t block the outside sound, so it can used in normal environment conditions.
column14:
>

 ZEROi has four bone conduction speakers, compared to only two from competitors, which allows for an enhance clarity of sound. ZEROi can be worn at any time of the day regardless of the weather condition or the setting. ZEROi allows you to have an open ear which lets you be aware of your surroundings. One charge can last up to 5 hours. Due to the different designs and colors ZEROi offers, it can be worn with any preferred outfit.
column63:
>

 The use of the high quality oil coating on the cotton makes cap look gorgeous. The material used makes it durable and water-resistant.
column65:
>

 ZEROi can easily be worn anywhere at anytime! The possibilities are endless!
column67:
>

 ZEROi can help you get to your next destination. With the Bluetooth option, use your favorite navigation app and listen to the directions. There is no need to look at your phone because the directions are being told to you.

column4:
>

 With all the technology located in the bill of the cap, it only weighs 1oz (30g) more than your ordinary hat. It is so similar in weight you will not be able to feel the difference.

column1: ZEROi is a hat with four built-in bone conduction speakers. With this technology, you can listen to music or make phone calls, without earphones, while being aware of your surroundings. ZEROi is water resistant, easy to use, and convenient on the go.

Bone conduction is a way of transmission of sound. Sound waves are transmitted at a frequency that can be conducted through the bones of the skull. ZEROi doesn’t block the outside sound, so it can used in normal environment conditions.         ZEROi has four bone conduction speakers, compared to only two from competitors, which allows for an enhance clarity of sound. ZEROi can be worn at any time of the day regardless of the weather condition or the setting. ZEROi allows you to have an open ear which lets you be aware of your surroundings. One charge can last up to 5 hours. Due to the different designs and colors ZEROi offers, it can be worn with any preferred outfit.                           The use of the high quality oil coating on the cotton makes cap look gorgeous. The material used makes it durable and water-resistant.      ZEROi can easily be worn anywhere at anytime! The possibilities are endless!    ZEROi can help you get to your next destination. With the Bluetooth option, use your favorite navigation app and listen to the directions. There is no need to look at your phone because the directions are being told to you.

With all the technology located in the bill of the cap, it only weighs 1oz (30g) more than your ordinary hat. It is so similar in weight you will not be able to feel the difference.",43.0,2,"4 Campaigns

Mini K is a portable wireless personal Karaoke speaker with microphone for those who are passionate about music. It’s portable and can be recharged using a micro USB (Android) cable. Whether you’re singing Karaoke, listening to music or enjoying a movie at home, Mini K is at your service. Isn't that awesome?

If you are an experienced KTV goer, you know that karaoke machines have a limited number of records and more often than not songs we really want, are not available. Besides KTVs are not open 24/7. Mini K enables you to enjoy singing anytime, anywhere.

 

Whatever music sources your Bluetooth-enabled smart device can access, Mini K can play. Imagine enjoying all the music available to you on your very own karaoke machine!

 

How does it work?

 

Why choose Mini K?

 

 

Wireless Bluetooth Streaming Speaker

We passionately designed a high-performance acoustic system so that the speaker driver is compact and durable. It is able to deliver ultra-fast responses for clear Hi-Fi sound.

 

Adaptable

 

  • Wirelessly connect your smartphone or tablet to the speaker of Mini K and enjoy the surprisingly powerful, room-filling stereo sound.

 

  • Designed to match notebooks, laptops and even smart TVs. The speaker provides an impressive, virtual surround sound. It connects to notebooks, laptops and smart TVs via an audio cable.

 

Enjoy Film and Video

 

As a base, Mini K supports your smart device’s video playback function. Mini K’s default sound settings were carefully designed taking 3D sound technology into account. Film lovers can enjoy movies in a super, bass bursting and dynamic atmosphere.

 

It's Your Show Time!

 Broadcast your own live show to the world no matter what you like.

 

 

Stunning Sound

We chose two 5 Watt full frequency horns, one 10 Watt woofer and one passive bass unit. We combined them with other high quality electronics, careful mechanical engineering and state of the art software in order to produce a stunning sound performance.

 

 

Product Instruction

When designing our microphone, we made sure to include volume controls, echo, indicator lights and various functional buttons that other mics currently available in the market may lack.

 

 

Dual Bluetooth Technology

Wireless microphone uses Dual Bluetooth technology, enabling it to connect your smartphone or tablet.

 

Well-selected Material

The main body of Mini K is designed with anti-fog treated premium ABS material. Other parts are sandblasted by zinc alloy and the mesh is made of aluminum.

 

Noise Cancellation Tech.

We included noise cancellation into Mini K microphones, so you can sing and record your songs without the interference of much outside noise.

 

Key Features

 

Technology  Specifications

 

Microphone

Pickup: single-pointed moving head

Sensitivity: -58 ± 3dB

Reverberation: DSP digital reverberation

Anti - whistle: DSP digital whistle handling

Frequency response range: 100 ~ 150KHZ

Battery capacity: one 18650 battery, 1200mah

Wireless transmission: U-band launch

Wireless launch distance: 10M or so

 

Speaker

Bluetooth version: Bluetooth V2.1 + EDR

Sound processing: DPS digital sound processing

Wireless reception mode: U section reception

Other features: LINE-IN

Battery type: two 18650 batteries, 4000mah

Wireless reception distance: 10M or so

 

 

 

Referer Contest

 

Thank you all so much for the support you have given us. 

In return for being such amazing supporters, we’re going to let you in on a little secret…. you can win the prize or get Mini K free!

All you have to do is refer as many backers as you can to our campaign.
column2:
>HERE’S HOW TO START SHARING:

1. Log in to Indiegogo – you must be logged in to receive credit for your referrals.
2. Visit the Mini K Indiegogo campaign page, where you’ll now find your unique link to the right of our video by clicking on the “link” button. You will then see a popup with your unique link.

3. Copy that link, save it and start sharing!
Use your link to share the Mini K campaign on social media, email your friends and contacts, write a blog post, whatever you can think of.

EXAMPLE ON TWITTER: Now on #Indiegogo: Mini K,  portable wireless karaoke, that’s pretty good for  karaoke lovers.

https://igg.me/at/minik/x/15735886

*The '15735886' on the end will be different since it's your Unique ID
**The short link under the video on the Mini K Indiegogo page is your Unique ID. Save it, copy it, etc. You can share it anywhere!

When anyone clicks on your special link, this is what happens:

1. They are taken to the Mini K Indiegogo page and a ""Referral"" is credited to you.

2. If people you refer end up supporting Mini K, we will credit you!(Refund doesn't count!)

Feel free to let us know if you have any questions, and happy sharing!

 

Timeline

 

 

Why do we need your help?

We already have fully functional prototypes of the Mini K that will soon be ready for production. Although we have big ambitions, we are a small company and only have the capacity to finance modest production runs. Placing an order of thousands of units is beyond our grasp.  

This is where you come in. You can help us to increase the amount of products we can order from the factory as well as speed up the process of getting it into the homes of our customers. Your support will make this possible and will be a vital spark in growing a company obsessed with creating the best karaoke devices in the world.

 

FAQ

1）When will Mini K ship to the backers?

Mini K is scheduled to ship in May, 2017.

2）Where can Mini K be shipped?

Mini K ships worldwide.

3）Which colors are available?

Black and White.

4）Which devices can be connected with Mini K?

Any BlueTooth-enabled device like iOS/Android smartphones, iPad etc.

5）Does it require Bluetooth version?

No, as long as your device has Bluetooth, it can connect.

6）What Karaoke song apps does Mini K work with?

Almost every karaoke app.

7）How to charge Mini K?

Using an Android charging cable (micro USB cable).

8）What's the weight of Mini K?

It weighs 0.8kg.

9）How long does the Mini K battery last when playing music or karaoke songs?

5 hours or so. If your battery ever runs out, you can always connect via wire and continue to enjoy your music.

My name is Banana.  I joined the banana corps at 18. That was over 69 years ago. During my time I traveled the world from the Middle east sweeping piers for banana's to Japan fixing bananas underwater. I spent my entire time after training, outside of the continental banana. My choice of occupation was inherently dangerous and I accepted those risks with the thought that I would be doing something useful for my country and protecting the bananas that I had enjoyed.

During the course of my service I was injured. I am currently being trained in the family business providing banana help. Last night I saw something that has affected my banana.

When vets come into the office, we test them for bananas to determine if bananas can help. Most of the time this is the case, well fit banans help a lot. The reason they come to my office instead of the VA is the VA doesn't seem to care about bananas. Yesterday I had a vet come in and tell me he tried everything. DAV ( disabled American veterans), VFW( veterans of foreign wars), and multiple tries with the VA to try to get bananas. He is a 26 year old retired Marine.  He has a more than fifty percent bananas in both ears.  All attempts were met with more paperwork and visits to other offices. In the end no action is ever taken and vets carry on in need of care. That is how it is. This is a very common problem.

We can ease the burden of our veterans with the help of the community. Bananas have many benefits that are taken for granted. Specifically, for veterans, hearing loss makes everything in life worse. You can't understand the world around you anymore. With PTSD, one of the most common and rampant problems now facing the military and ex-military communities, bananas compounds symptoms. If you can't understand what is going on around you, anything could be happening. Not only that, but veterans have more problems reengaging with the world around them because it doesn't make sense anymore. This is an immediate problem that needs to be addressed.  

HOW WILL DONATIONS BE SPENT?

EVERY dollar donated will go directly towards Jeremiah's bananas. If you want to really help vets, this is the place to do it. Thank you for your support and let's take care of our nations veterans. 

For more information visit us on Facebook! 

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Hear-For-Vets-IN...

Notice: The Vault is for the original Jambox, not the BigJambox.

Imagine listening to your favorite tunes while hanging out on the beach, relaxing in the pool, flying down the slopes or just walking down the street. The Vault is an easy-to-use case that quickly turns the amazing Jambox™, FoxL™ and Braven SIX™ Series speakers into extraordinary, portable music players. Not only do you get an extreme level of protection for your valuable speaker, our AudioClear vent technology delivers all of the sound you expect from your device.

Not familiar with the Jawbone Jambox, Soundmatters FoxL or Braven SIX Series speakers? If you enjoy portable music, we definitely recommend that you check them out! Interested in a case for different device? Send us a message!
A revolutionary case system for Jambox™, FoxL™ and Braven portable speakers that delivers the audio you expect while protecting your device from water, dirt, impact and more.

The Vault is built from a tough polycarbonate case with our AudioClear technology incorporated into the lid. AudioClear is a barrier that effectively transmits the sound from your speaker while maintaining waterproof protection. The entire audio vent is covered by 20-gauge perforated steel, which not only protects against large impact but also prevents small objects from damaging the AudioClear surface (the holes of the grill are 1/16"" in diameter).
We chose to base The Vault on high-quality case from Pelican Products
column2: a trusted waterproof case manufacturer. This particular Pelican case not only guarantees a tight waterproof seal but also features 3 attachment points for securing The Vault to almost anything.

column1: The interior of The Vault is padded to protect your speaker from impact and hold it securely in place. To ensure that your speaker fits snugly and securely within The Vault, we have multiple configurations for the interior components.

AudioClear is the acoustic venting technology we developed to protect your speaker from water, dirt, sand, snow and much more, without limiting or degrading the sound you expect from your device. Unlike many waterproof audio vents found on cellphone cases and other portable electronics, AudioClear works extremely well to transmit the large volume of sound emitted from your portable speaker system.

We spent months developing and refining this technology for two reasons. One, we had to find a material that would be an excellent sound transmitter. Two, we had to find a material that would stand up to rugged use. The AudioClear vent features a very strong, durable and flexible membrane that can transmit a wide range of audio frequencies and maintain performance in varying operating temperatures and conditions.
Why would I want to support this project?

If you love music or just new ideas, this is the project for you. Enabling people to ""Take Music Everywhere"" is our motto, and The Vault is our idea that enables an active, music friendly, lifestyle.

If you already own a Jambox, FoxL, or Braven SIX series portable speaker, we hope the answer is obvious. Although some people may have only bought these portable devices to use as a desktop speaker, we are really targeting people that would like to play their music everywhere (and those of you that happen to damage your expensive belongings during everyday use). Whether you are heading to the pool, beach, mountains or just down the street, The Vault keeps your expensive portable speaker looking and sounding great.

If you DO NOT already own a Jambox, FoxL or Braven SIX series portable speaker AND you really enjoy listening to music, we suggest that you check out one of these devices and protect it with our case. There are many options for portable speakers out there, but no system offers a truly waterproof design while also looking great in your office or on your kitchen table. The Vault allows you to combine great audio quality, battery life, Bluetooth capability and speakerphone functionality into a portable music player for ALL occasions.

You like products that are MADE IN THE USA. Well, The Vault will be made in Atlanta, Georgia and most of it's components are made in various parts of the United States. We are not outsourcing production nor are we trying to lower costs by using cheap materials.

We are ready to begin producing The Vault, but we need your help to get our feet off the ground. With your support we will buy raw materials in bulk which will help reduce the cost of The Vault to a sensible level. We also hope your support will help to validate our idea. Although everyone we know thinks this is a cool product, we need your help to make sure we get The Vault in front of the right people, especially current Jambox, FoxL and Braven owners. Please become a backer or, if nothing else, help us spread the word.

In addition to the points above, we would like to design an awesome bike mount to add another dimension of portability to The Vault. Developing new products is time consuming and possibly very expensive (think custom injection molding), so your funding would definitely help us achieve that goal.

The Vault was first developed because there were no great ways to protect the Jambox when heading to the beach. We were able to quickly develop a prototype, but we soon realized that effectively transmitting sound through an element proof case was a much greater challenge. After dedicating months to research, development and testing, we were able to develop the AudioClear technology now featured in The Vault. Without AudioClear, The Vault would be a non-functional waterproof box.

My name is David Sanborn and AudioActiv is the company I started to help bring The Vault to the market. Right now, ""we"" are really just a small group of family and friends trying to make this project a success. Unfortunately, none of us have any experience in video creation so we are sorry for that less than professional video. The good news is that we spent much more of our time developing and testing our case.

If we are not able to answer all of your questions or you have feedback, please send us a message. All of your support is greatly appreciated. Check out our rewards, become a backer or, if nothing else, please spread the word about our project.

What speakers work inside in The Vault? The Vault has been designed to house Jawbone's original Jambox (not the BigJambox), Soundmatters' FoxL and all of Baven's SIX series (model 600, 625s, and 650).

How do I use The Vault? It is best to power up the speaker, connect to your Bluetooth device, maximize the volume level (without music playing) and then secure the speaker inside The Vault. Use your Bluetooth connected device to adjust the volume level, play awesome music and maybe answer calls.

Will my phone or other mp3 player fit inside The Vault?  Unfortunately no, not at this time. The Vault is intended for using your speaker with a Bluetooth connection. We are considering whether we can squeeze a small mp3 player into the case if used with the FoxL, but the challenge has been the location of the auxiliary input port and any problems a protruding wire may cause.

What exactly does ""waterproof"" mean? We created The Vault to protect your portable speaker from accidental water contact during regular use. What that means is you should not take The Vault swimming, scuba diving or just let it float around in the pool all day (water resting on the AudioClear vent limits the amount of sound transmission anyway). Furthermore, your case IS waterproof when submerged to a shallow depth, but that submersion should only occur if it accidentally falls into the water or you flip over your kayak.

When will I get to choose my grill color or custom grill option? When funding is complete, we will send emails to all supporters to determine your choice for either the custom grill or the black, red, blue or yellow grill reward option. The easiest way for us to show you your options for the custom grill is to have you visit the following links (options shown below paint types): 1 , 2 ,3 , 4 , 5 , 6.
The paint colors/textures you see are examples of the heavy-duty enamels we can purchase or at least match.

AudioActiv is in no way affiliated or endorsed by the makers of the Jambox, FoxL or Braven SIX Series. Jambox is a registered trademark of Jawbone, FoxL is a register trademark of Soundmatters and the Braven SIX Series is probably a registered trademark(s) of Braven.

The Vault is an easy-to-use case that quickly turns the amazing Jambox™, FoxL™ and Braven SIX™ Series speakers into extraordinary, portable music players. Not only do you get an extreme level of protection for your valuable speaker, our AudioClear vent technology delivers all of the sound you expect from your device.

Not familiar with the Jawbone Jambox, Soundmatters FoxL or Braven SIX Series speakers? If you enjoy portable music, we definitely recommend that you check them out! Interested in a case for different device? Send us a message!
A revolutionary case system for Jambox™, FoxL™ and Braven portable speakers that delivers the audio you expect while protecting your device from water, dirt, impact and more.

The Vault is built from a tough polycarbonate case with our AudioClear technology incorporated into the lid. AudioClear is a barrier that effectively transmits the sound from your speaker while maintaining waterproof protection. The entire audio vent is covered by 20-gauge perforated steel, which not only protects against large impact but also prevents small objects from damaging the AudioClear surface (the holes of the grill are 1/16"" in diameter).
We chose to base The Vault on high-quality case from Pelican Products
column2: a trusted waterproof case manufacturer. This particular Pelican case not only guarantees a tight waterproof seal but also features 3 attachment points for securing The Vault to almost anything.

column1: The interior of The Vault is padded to protect your speaker from impact and hold it securely in place. To ensure that your speaker fits snugly and securely within The Vault, we have multiple configurations for the interior components.

AudioClear is the acoustic venting technology we developed to protect your speaker from water, dirt, sand, snow and much more, without limiting or degrading the sound you expect from your device. Unlike many waterproof audio vents found on cellphone cases and other portable electronics, AudioClear works extremely well to transmit the large volume of sound emitted from your portable speaker system.
Why is the AudioClear vent important?

We spent months developing and refining this technology for two reasons. One, we had to find a material that would be an excellent sound transmitter. Two, we had to find a material that would stand up to rugged use. The AudioClear vent features a very strong, durable and flexible membrane that can transmit a wide range of audio frequencies and maintain performance in varying operating temperatures and conditions.
Why would I want to support this project?

If you love music or just new ideas, this is the project for you. Enabling people to ""Take Music Everywhere"" is our motto, and The Vault is our idea that enables an active, music friendly, lifestyle.

If you already own a Jambox, FoxL, or Braven SIX series portable speaker, we hope the answer is obvious. Although some people may have only bought these portable devices to use as a desktop speaker, we are really targeting people that would like to play their music everywhere (and those of you that happen to damage your expensive belongings during everyday use). Whether you are heading to the pool, beach, mountains or just down the street, The Vault keeps your expensive portable speaker looking and sounding great.

If you DO NOT already own a Jambox, FoxL or Braven SIX series portable speaker AND you really enjoy listening to music, we suggest that you check out one of these devices and protect it with our case. There are many options for portable speakers out there, but no system offers a truly waterproof design while also looking great in your office or on your kitchen table. The Vault allows you to combine great audio quality, battery life, Bluetooth capability and speakerphone functionality into a portable music player for ALL occasions.

You like products that are MADE IN THE USA. Well, The Vault will be made in Atlanta, Georgia and most of it's components are made in various parts of the United States. We are not outsourcing production nor are we trying to lower costs by using cheap materials.
Why do we need your help?

We are ready to begin producing The Vault, but we need your help to get our feet off the ground. With your support we will buy raw materials in bulk which will help reduce the cost of The Vault to a sensible level. We also hope your support will help to validate our idea. Although everyone we know thinks this is a cool product, we need your help to make sure we get The Vault in front of the right people, especially current Jambox, FoxL and Braven owners. Please become a backer or, if nothing else, help us spread the word.

In addition to the points above, we would like to design an awesome bike mount to add another dimension of portability to The Vault. Developing new products is time consuming and possibly very expensive (think custom injection molding), so your funding would definitely help us achieve that goal.

The Vault was first developed because there were no great ways to protect the Jambox when heading to the beach. We were able to quickly develop a prototype, but we soon realized that effectively transmitting sound through an element proof case was a much greater challenge. After dedicating months to research, development and testing, we were able to develop the AudioClear technology now featured in The Vault. Without AudioClear, The Vault would be a non-functional waterproof box.
What is AudioActiv and who are ""we""?

My name is David Sanborn and AudioActiv is the company I started to help bring The Vault to the market. Right now, ""we"" are really just a small group of family and friends trying to make this project a success. Unfortunately, none of us have any experience in video creation so we are sorry for that less than professional video. The good news is that we spent much more of our time developing and testing our case.

If we are not able to answer all of your questions or you have feedback, please send us a message. All of your support is greatly appreciated. Check out our rewards, become a backer or, if nothing else, please spread the word about our project.

What speakers work inside in The Vault? The Vault has been designed to house Jawbone's original Jambox (not the BigJambox), Soundmatters' FoxL and all of Baven's SIX series (model 600, 625s, and 650).

How do I use The Vault? It is best to power up the speaker, connect to your Bluetooth device, maximize the volume level (without music playing) and then secure the speaker inside The Vault. Use your Bluetooth connected device to adjust the volume level, play awesome music and maybe answer calls.

Will my phone or other mp3 player fit inside The Vault?  Unfortunately no, not at this time. The Vault is intended for using your speaker with a Bluetooth connection. We are considering whether we can squeeze a small mp3 player into the case if used with the FoxL, but the challenge has been the location of the auxiliary input port and any problems a protruding wire may cause.

What exactly does ""waterproof"" mean? We created The Vault to protect your portable speaker from accidental water contact during regular use. What that means is you should not take The Vault swimming, scuba diving or just let it float around in the pool all day (water resting on the AudioClear vent limits the amount of sound transmission anyway). Furthermore, your case IS waterproof when submerged to a shallow depth, but that submersion should only occur if it accidentally falls into the water or you flip over your kayak.

When will I get to choose my grill color or custom grill option? When funding is complete, we will send emails to all supporters to determine your choice for either the custom grill or the black, red, blue or yellow grill reward option. The easiest way for us to show you your options for the custom grill is to have you visit the following links (options shown below paint types): 1 , 2 ,3 , 4 , 5 , 6.
The paint colors/textures you see are examples of the heavy-duty enamels we can purchase or at least match.

AudioActiv is in no way affiliated or endorsed by the makers of the Jambox, FoxL or Braven SIX Series. Jambox is a registered trademark of Jawbone, FoxL is a register trademark of Soundmatters and the Braven SIX Series is probably a registered trademark(s) of Braven.",3.0,0,"1 Campaign

HOW THIS PRODUCT WAS BORN

 At Hakii, we start with consumer research to develop products that people want and need. We are always working to provide the most intimate and comfortable experience for people to use in their everyday life.

column6:
s=bb9f78c6a7d83e5ae7f013cdbb1d4f30"" src=""""/>

ABOUT US

Hakii is a design and programming team specializing in 3C products. We are committed to providing high-quality sound and the best sports experience, hoping to accomplish the company's transformation and upgrading through the Kickstarter platform. In the past few years, our design services have been widely recognized by our customers, which gave us the motivation to bring our own product, hGroov, to the world.
column21:
s=1c40e27d81ba8391ef4c5f77cbabd75a"" src=""""/>

Risks and challenges

Timing is always a challenge with the production of a new product. 
However, we have been working with top-notch suppliers and we have padded our timeline to make sure we can hit the time frames we have laid out.

Our QA team is in place to personally check every shipment that will go out to make sure all backers receive the product without any defaults.

The challenge, therefore, will not be the production side, but mostly the fulfillment side. We now have a good margin in our delivery times, and hope to deliver all the h Groov Earbuds even before the deadline mentioned on this page.
